Review.Titre: Siteground is WAY WAY WAY behind the…
Review.Contenu: Siteground is WAY WAY WAY behind the curve on PHP.  Period.  End of story.  It sounds like your team are taking steps to mitigate risk, but that's not the right answer.  The right answer is to force customers to a supported version of PHP.None of this is the support technician's fault.  He handled the chat extremely well.At the very least, a new account shouldn't allow 7.4 or 8.0.  It's idiotic that you're allowing the problem to get BIGGER!!!

Review.Titre: My issue lies with the auto renew…
Review.Contenu: My issue lies with the auto renew process, which happened in my case, 15 days in advance of the domain expiration date. I was under the impression that I had opted to not auto renew, which applied to the hosting part only. I have therefore been charged for the domain for another year and I no longer require the site. When I contacted them on the same day about a refund, I was told a refund was no longer possible and it was out of their hands. As a small business this is a lot of money of which big companies like Siteground are happy to take advantage. I could understand if auto renew kicked in 3 days in advance, but 15 days??

Review.Titre: They just want more money from you...
Review.Contenu: I was notified on 12/12 that there was malicious code in one of my websites. On 12/13 I contacted my web designer to try to find the problem. She could not. Siteground was happy to charge me $100 to remove the code. Then they had the gall to say that my web designer somehow uploaded the malicious code the day after they detected it!?! Time travel? I'm not sure. Bottom line, they continued to blame the web designer even though the facts they produced showed the bad code was there before she stepped into the picture. They are either liars or ignorant. I don't care which, I'm moving all my sites to another host company. The fact that they can't fess up and admit that it was their poor security that allowed this malicious code is reason enough for me to move to another vendor.

Review.Titre: worse support ever seen
Review.Contenu: i never seen in my life support or website like that no chat option such as any company you need one hour and tens of steps to be able to chat  in addition to i sent alink to my brother to deal with them  he could not contact them ask him  to pay f1 to chat or ticket, they only professional creating fake accounts to please themselves instead of respecting costumers or improve their website services

Review.Titre: Do not make my mistake and sign up for SiteGround
Review.Contenu: SiteGround may entice you with their low initial price, but their rates significantly increase in the second year compared to other providers. I am migrating my website to Hostinger, as they offer better performance and more competitive prices

Review.Titre: I used to be able to call a number!
Review.Contenu: I used to be able to call a number and speak with a support person.This was a big reason why I switched to SiteGround even though it is more expensive than my old hosting platform.If I can't get phone support without a bunch of hassle, I may have to re-evaluate my decision and look for a platform that can provide a better support experience.

Review.Titre: Treated like a dog in customer support one big scam tbh
Review.Contenu: Treated like a dog in customer support, after taking the offer they gave me they refused to help me unless I paid them 6x the price. Danis didn't help me at all he just repeated the same bs sentence and quit our conversation randomly. After being loyal customer to siteground for 4 years I rather pay double elsewhere than stay with these guys any longer. STAY AWAY : They will rip you off after a year charging you 6/7x the initial amount and if you don't pay they will shut down your projects and websites.

Review.Titre: Dreadful
Review.Contenu: Dreadful. guy was very good 5 stars for him. But siteground - 50 stars Shocking experience. Toook 90 mins to get on chat I went with every option over and over and eventually it gave chat as an option. Totally unfair. I dont need this. I need a direct link to chat else will have to go elsewhere

Review.Titre: Anti-bot ruining my business
Review.Contenu: Anti-bot ruining my business. Every time I asked to disable the service. automatically it's reactivated. Can't get why Sitegroun providing this not-tested service without letting customers. also can't get why they did not provide any option in the hosting panel. I will rethink this rating. If you provide an option on the client end so that customers can disable/enable on their own.

Review.Titre: Siteground values ​​a new client more…
Review.Contenu: Siteground values ​​a new client more than me who has been with you for years. Worse, make it public! Congratulations on the - lack of - strategy. In the future, when I become a new client again, perhaps we will do business again. For now, fire your manager, you'll do a lot of good.EDIT: Just to clarify your answer here just proves my point. Your "loyalty discount" is still much lesser than the prices offered to new customers as I said. Point proved. Period. Nothing to add about it. The rest is just shenanigans to try to show as a "good guy" to the market. IF YOU REALLY VALUED the commercial relationship we had I'd have had renewed my signature but instead I downloaded my backup from your server. Guess why? Because I'm gone. Have a great day.

Review.Titre: Unable to reach phone support for past 27 hours
Review.Contenu: For the past 27 hours, I have been unable to reach Siteground support by phone. Hosted by Siteground, my small business website is pointing to the wrong site. Customers are calling to complain that my website is down. I am unable to complete steps to reach phone support because Siteground's AI agent won't allow me to complete the process. Hopefully, Siteground will take steps to make it easier for customers experiencing website issues like the one I described to reach their phone support team.Update: Two hours after writing this review, I received communication by e-mail from Siteground with step-by-step instructions for reaching phone support. Over the phone, Siteground was able to fix my issue.

Review.Titre: No response from Gabriel P
Review.Contenu: No response from Gabriel P.  No resolution to my problem and no acknowledgment that my uploaded file was received or acceptable.Chat only wasted time unfortunately.

Review.Titre: Siteground kinda didnt tell me like it reall was.
Review.Contenu: Siteground disappointed me.  When I purchased the service I specifically asked if they have phone support for 30 days or so, because I'm older and have difficulty navigating the transition to the Blogger I was going to use.  They said they had unlimited easy phone support. They lied, their phone support was tricky , I tried to get their passkey to make a phone call and failed many times. Perhaps my fault but I told them about my difficulties up front. I had to cancel before I ever started. The experience was extremely frustrating . They also didnt have a real person chat easily available .  They might be great for a Tekkie , but for an 80 with eye issues and not so quick, definitely go somewhere with better customer service.

Review.Titre: Siteground Punishes customer when they break your site
Review.Contenu: For 8 years, my site has worked with no problem on hostgator.Now that I am on siteground my site is constantly offline. Siteground is taking my site down to punish me as a client. My site is 17GB, and I have purchased 60GB of space. Today I decided to try Siteground's optimizer plugin. I tried their plugin before but it broke my site. When I contacted them about it they blamed me for using their plugin on my site and said I was causing the problem. Today I tried it in my staging copy and it broke my site again. I gave up and deleted the staging copy. I still had plugins to try so I created another staging copy. I opened that staging copy and I got site grounds "site under construction page" even though I have a full website. So I deleted that copy and tried again to create a staging copy.After that my site went offline. I could not access my portal or anything. I called Siteground and they told me I was over 60 Gn space.. But I was only using 17gb. Even though I deleted the staging copies that 1. was destroyed by sitegrounds plugin and 2. a staging copy that never worked. So in essence my company's website does not work because I tried a Siteground plugin that didn't work, so Siteground is punishing me by taking my site down. Now my site is taking 45 GB even though it's only 17 GB and I have no staging copies. So old copies of staging sites that I erased are keeping me offline because Siteground is saying I am over my disk space limit... So if you use their tools as intended, Siteground will break your site and no one there takes any responsibility now that my 17gb site is taking more than 45 GB, siteground is blaming me and my site is offline. If your business relies on a website, the worst decision you can make is to use SitegroundTheir reply is what they do - blame customers. I deleted the staging copies from my server. The Siteground server did not process the deletion. SO their glitch took me down. Please read their reply. They said my staging copies (that I deleted) put me over the limit. I was not over the limit! A glitch in their server left my deleted copies, and their automated system took me down. So if you want a company that punishes first, doesn't listen when it's their innocent mistake, and then bends over backwards to blame you... Siteground is the place to go. Congrat on blaming again Siteground... Enjoy your hubris. Tell everyone again how it was my fault...

Review.Titre: Terrible Joomla hosting that they charged for and no longer support
Review.Contenu: They sold me a Joomla hosting plan two years ago & over time have removed any Joomla support, and stopped updating it which left big holes in the security of my site. They now refuse to give me a refund on my hosting plan after I have had to move my site to a new host because they were not fit for purpose.

Review.Titre: I have been a customer for multiple…
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer for multiple years. But lately support has become super bad. They take down a website of a big client of mine after an email marketing campaign, because of to much traffic. The same email marketing has been done multiple years, without any issues. Siteground will call it a DOS attack even after we informed them it's because of the email marketing campaign. Instead of helping out, they will try to sell you a bigger more expensive plan. In the meanwhile the site is offline. Siteground mentions: they do this in order to protect other customers which are on the same server. We even had a Go Geek server. It's really unbelievable, that you will mess up my business with my customer and don't take a proactive approach to solve this issue. Instead you only try to upsell en come up with general nonsense ideas about caching. Therefore i don't recommend anyone to move to siteground

Review.Titre: Do not move to Siteground.
Review.Contenu: Do not move to Siteground.I have multiple websites and domains with them. Have been a customer for over 7 years. Never had any issues until the last 2 weeks.They will literally suspend and threaten to suspend your websites for no legitimate reason. They send you emails asking for changes within 24 hours otherwise they will take action to damage the website.When I get time I will move to a legitimate website host.

Review.Titre: Hosting good...Email marketing bad
Review.Contenu: I've used the hosting for years with minimal issues. Usually the ebb & flow of the quality of support but overall hosting is solid. Email marketing is not. Paid for 1000 contacts / 10000 email sends and was unable to send a total of <1800 emails to my list of 900 contacts. So I paid to upgrade contact limit, it was just a guess since I already had less contacts than what I paid for. Then the email marketing service was suspended.

Review.Titre: Brutal policies
Review.Contenu: Somehow notifications for renewal were turned off on my account so 60 websites went offline this morning without any warning whatsoever. How can Siteground think that is acceptable customer service. I'm still in shock!Update: thanks for the explanation but what I really don't get is that you sent a warning email AFTER taking down every website - would it not make more sense to warn me that it was about to happen? Thank God I wasn't lying on a beach off grid for a week!

Review.Titre: Evasive Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Siteground seems great on the surface, but it's VERY expensive. For a small company, their rates are outrageous. They massively overcharged me on services and then refused to refund me.I asked if I could cancel WHEN I received the massive outrageous bill, and they ignored me completely. No offer to downgrade, no offer of a refund. Just complete radio silence.Which is hardly surprising as I've been speaking to some guy there at SiteGround and I've seen less slippery eels.I'm sure there'll be a reply on here about blah blah blah (while they try to make it look like I am somehow in the wrong), but the facts are I could include the email trail here, and the abject lack of offer of a refund on the outrageous pricing for what I needed. The chat rep originally said I was paying way more than I needed to, and yet nothing was done.So I'll take this further, but I can't wait to see the response here about how you offered amazing value for the service, or some other excuse.Well, the facts are a company is based on how it deals with its complaints, and here you've been evasive, deliberately incompetent, and absolutely refusing to refund me, over the past 11 months.OK. I'm dying to see your public response.TLDR: Customer Service is everything.Update: Exactly as promised. They said nothing in that message (did you see?). They have ignored my last few emails to them. Because it's more important to focus on obtaining positive reviews from brand new customers than it is in providing positive support to existing customers. Just like they ignored my requests to cancel my subscription when I found it it was over £280 a year (to host emails).They insultingly actually offered me a discount on another year's membership. Still massively overpriced, so there you go. Thanks but I'll go with Hostinger instead.

Review.Titre: Prices increase at renewal - 4 times as much!
Review.Contenu: SiteGround offers attractive special pricing, but those prices increase significantly when it's time to renew your plan. Last year when it came to renewing my hosting they allowed me to move my website from expiring hosting plan to a new one that I already have with them, purchased at the discounted rate. This year their chat assistant Georgi K. did not allow me to do that, therefore trying to force me to renew at 4 times the price I paid last year or the price you would pay this year if you purchased new rather than renew. Seems to me like a trap, I am looking at other hosting providers to migrate too, most offer a free migration service so not falling for their scam to pay silly prices.

Review.Titre: Don’t give these guys your credit card…
Review.Contenu: Don’t give these guys your credit card details. Standard auto renew predators. Annual fees went from $89/annum to $489/annum (this includes a 20% DISCOUNT for paying annually). I will be going elsewhere

Review.Titre: $500+ / year hosting sucks
Review.Contenu: $500+ / year hosting1. My site got very slow after they switched from CloudFlare to their in-house CDN.2. Initial tech was dismissive and blamed me for the problem3. Social media operators gave me the run around and recommended support content that was wrong.Different employees have referred me to other employees, yet they are all equally useless.Now looking for a replacement.

Review.Titre: TAKING MONEY, NO SUPPORT!
Review.Contenu: I never have subscriptions and this company have taken money from my account without any emails or information to even mention anything about this.Luckily I noticed my bill. Now I am having to contact them and find out there is no way contact or support!

Review.Titre: They neglect existing customers
Review.Contenu: The support was very nice to me.My feedback goes to the policy Siteground puts in place. Basically, they don't care about their existing customers. They try to suck as much money as they can from them since your are already stuck with their service. While, for new customers, they offer plans for half the price. Note that the promotions  that I am talking about have nowhere to be found anything saying that they only apply to "New customers".Very disappointing.

Review.Titre: Trying to get into my account and…
Review.Contenu: Trying to get into my account and Siteground has no customer service other than through their portal. I enter the credentials and it forces me to get a verification. FINE It's stupid though because it won't verify after that. I tried getting it through an email and phone. Nothing works. No customer service numbers and they don't respond for the sales area. Amazingly bad. Now I need to contact an attorney... BAD BUSINESS

Review.Titre: Charged for 3 weeks not 4
Review.Contenu: I always had a lot of outages...customer service was rude and would often refuse to help even though my issues were related to hosting. But the reason I'm writing this review is that I recently updated my card on file. When I made the update I noticed they were charging me at 3 weeks instead of 4 weeks - thus stealing a whole week of service/payment.  They need to get honest with their billing and accounting.

Review.Titre: Loyal Customers pay 4 times the price.
Review.Contenu: I have been a good paying customer for three years only to discover that I'm paying £280 for hosting while new customers can get it for £60. I understand special offers, but that's alot extra to pay for being loyal. They do offer a good service so if you're new to them, the deal is worth it. I'm sad to be leaving but it's a point of principal, I will find another company who is offering the same deal to new customers.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service…
Review.Contenu: Everything is fine until you try and cancel the contract. I  cancelled some 6 months ago which was acknowledged. I then find that they have charged my debit card an annual renewal charge even though autro renewal was not activated. There is no email address or phone number to contact them so left in limbo. I cannot get a chargeback via mastercard unless i can produce original emails detailing cancellation, all the bank can do is block any future charges. Very annoyed to say the least

Review.Titre: They charged my card almost $350 two…
Review.Contenu: They charged my card about $330 two whole years after I purchased their services. When I asked them to refund, they told me they wouldn't because they had warned me in an email. Even if I hadn't used a somewhat obscure email address, emails get buried incredibly easily.I've never been more screwed by a company on the internet than by SiteGround. Just looking at the word still makes me flinch. I'll never forget it. Save yourself the headache.  ALSO: They reply to your Trustpilot review by sharing private information with everyone so you delete your review. Only the positive reviews remain. What a racket.

Review.Titre: They will try and trap you into…
Review.Contenu: They will try and trap you into contracts and force you to renew their service rather than transfer away from them. Their support is also poor.Edit:- The issue, as you have ignored again in your reply, is that you don’t advise anywhere in advance that you can only transfer one site away per day. Unless you know this you can’t plan to transfer away in time which results in the account expiring and having to renew just to transfer a site away.In addition your support team literally lie about this and have a ‘gotcha’ attitude knowing you can’t not pay the renewal just to transfer away. It’s not good enough and is underhand behaviour.

Review.Titre: Shady sales technique puts me off immediately.
Review.Contenu: Can't comment on how good they are as a host but their site boasts about their plans being £x.99 per month, which seems reasonable. Then you realise it's excluding VAT, so you think, 'fair enough', they aren't the only company with that annoying practice. Then they totally wreck any trust you might have been ready to give them by adding in very small print, way down the page, that those prices only apply if you pay for 12 months in one go. Something affordable becomes something you start to wonder if you need after all. I know other companies work this way, but a company I could trust would be the one that stood apart from that tactic, especially when the monthly price is more than THREE TIMES as much!

Review.Titre: Increase the value of execution time is not possible in shared hosting.
Review.Contenu: Increase the value of execution time is not possible in shared hosting.In addition who gave me support wasted my time attempting several things that didn't really works.At the end of every "effective" customer care request they tried to transformation problem to opportunity: upgrade your plan and your problem are solved :) .I solved installing locally the software that need an higher memory but I am very disappointed, if you have some euro more Digital Ocean is a more honest option.

Review.Titre: Wouldn't give 1 start if I could
Review.Contenu: Wouldn't give 1 start if I could. After spending a year with them and their rude customer service staff I wanted out but because of hospital admission I couldn't download my data and never knew I had to. I am being bullied to buy a month's plan so that I could download my own data for my own website which I worked extremely hard for. They even auto renewed my data when I never wanted to be with them anymore due to the rude customer service staff I have come across. Never sign up with these people. They are running many money making schemes and will hold your data and bully you!!!

Review.Titre: Keep away
Review.Contenu: No support.Many claims of support on their website but it is non existent.Beware that purchasing and paying for a domain will not provide you with email address unless you pay additional fees for hosting.

Review.Titre: Sitegroud destroy our web SEO position!!!
Review.Contenu: NO phone service for an emergency and also when we migrate the website to site ground for some reason, site ground injects a "no follow tag" in the head of the site making it invisible for the search engine and for instance the 10 years working with SEO die !! and our website is in a very bad position now! Dont use site ground !!!

Review.Titre: Most disappointing experience!
Review.Contenu: It is the most disappointing hosting I have ever worked with and I have worked with a few. 1. They charge you automatically without sending a notice to see if you want to renew or not.2. The customer service is practically non-existent. It is easier to talk to Putin in Russia than to a person in this company. I couldn't get a number or a ticket to talk to anyone about my billing.3. Naturally I cancelled my hosting plan and they cancel immediately even though I have another 10 days to go which I had paid for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Literally go with any other hosting site. The prices are the same and chances are you get better customer service.

Review.Titre: Impossible to get support
Review.Contenu: Impossible to get support! They use only chat that none ever replies. The web says 4 min of waiting but they never come. Hours of waiting online.No email or phone to get in contact.The bug on their website mistakenly made my card invalid. Now I cannot renew the domain because i do not have another card. And there is ZERo support from them.After 2 days of trying I gave up and moved to another service provider.

Review.Titre: Inflexible and unhelpful - they only care about pushing upgrades
Review.Contenu: Inflexible and unhelpfulI have several sites with them and recently paid £906.77 for three years up front.  Since which time the service has taken to demanding more and more upgrades.  This morning we sent a regular newsletter and they turned our site off - and have refused to reinstate it despite the 'peak' of hits from a newsletter probably taking only an hour as users get it.  I don't feel they care about supporting my business, just strong-arming an emergency payment to upgrade my package for an incident that has probably already cooled off.  This is not supporting business customers - it's blackmailing them.

Review.Titre: Have been a Siteground user for years…
Review.Contenu: Have been a Siteground user for years and have brought a lot of clients to them but they refused to give me a refund after they auto renewed my domain that I hadn't used for months. Terrible customer service. Instead of simply refunding me EUR 15, they decided to go with the "company policy" - I will not renew my services there and will bring all my future clients elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Great service but dishonest
Review.Contenu: 1-star - I was contacted by Trustpilot that if I don't give my full name and phone number to Siteground my review will be deleted. Name and phone number provided along with a 1-star review. Great service but when it comes to renewals they will use the credit card you have and even if you turn off the auto-renewal they'll charge your card. Every few months I have to go in and request a refund.Since Siteground was kind enough to reply, I would like to add that every time I go in to cancel automatic billing I get billed on my credit card anyways. Then I have to get online, choose the correct domain and start a chat with customer service. Then they will take me through a lengthy (but always very respectful and helpful) process of refunding me any billed items I didn't approve. On more than one occasion I wasn't eligible for a refund either because the time had passed or another reason. I don't see why I can't choose autorenewal and why it can't function like it does on other services.

Review.Titre: They cause more problems than they solve
Review.Contenu: They support here is horrific, they deflect their flaws they cause on their client websites, then insult the clients for complaining about their poor service, truly pathetic!!! Avoid wasting money here!

Review.Titre: The employee tells me frankly to leave…
Review.Contenu: The employee tells me frankly to leave with your websites siteground, is this normal?!if there’s any way to upload screenshot i will pleasure i need to know how this is possible?!iam client in siteground with more than 5 years and you are my first recommendation to all

Review.Titre: Bad service with expansive fares
Review.Contenu: I used siteground for many years starting from 2016 which was referred to by a friend. But I can say I am really regret to use them. The problem was to where I can move my websites. The websites were not fast enough to be browsed and their customer service usually took long time to get back to me. Furthermore charging more money for any basic service like backups for example. Finally I decided to move to a new web hosting where I found all what I am looking for and a cheaper service and very professional customer service and I am really very happy for leaving siteground. Not recommended at all

Review.Titre: SLA violation
Review.Contenu: I have been with Siteground shared hosting for a few years. In the last few days my small low traffic website is getting DDoS attack. I proactively reacted to requests of their tech team. They wanted me to switch from Siteground CDN to CloudFlare CDN which I did.DDoS attacks is about mitigating them and waiting for them to pass. Instead of responsive tech support to deal with this issue together, what I see is that they are trying to sell me an expensive switch to Cloud Hosting (with the same guarantee of shared hosting). The even more otrageous thing is that today, although no DDoS attack they are keeping my website offline in violation of SLA and they are litterally blackmailing me that either I switch to Cloud hosting or they keep me offline.I have one year and 3 months left paid hosting with them.Shameful company!

Review.Pseudo: Thomas de Tombe de Tombe Tradi
Review.Titre: Experience with Technical Support
Review.Contenu: Technical support is slow in responding, asking for phone support is rejected. Asking for the next steps isn't replied... waiting fro 30 minutes... no reply... so not cool

Review.Titre: Absolute waste of space
Review.Contenu: Absolute waste of space. You can't use Outlook 365 and add domains and use webmail. The service is not fit for purpose and the support is patronising and rudee.

Review.Titre: Extremely expensive for average hosting and terrible customer service - don't get caught up.
Review.Contenu: Have been using Siteground Cloud hosting to host around 30 websites for the last 2 years which has been ok but unbelievably expensive compared to others for basic hosting (over 4x more expensive!). Stuck with them to avoid the hassle of moving all 30 websites, however absolutely shocked to find out the cost of adding additional storage space onto cloud hosting plans. Siteground charge £3.60/month/10gb and by comparison Google Drive is £7.99/month/2TB (equivalent to 4p/10gb/month) making Siteground over  90x more expensive for online storage space. For a basic 100gb extra it would increase hosting to £108/month. Called up Siteground to check that this is not an error on their part, and was told that if I didn't want to pay over 90x for storage space then I should leave immediately. Not really how you expect to be spoken to after spending over £2000 with them since joining. Would strongly recommend to seriously consider other hosting providers if you plan on scaling, otherwise you'll be stuck paying ludicrous prices. All in all very disappointing as Siteground has been fine up until now.

Review.Titre: Can't refund! Have to Renew for sites transfer!
Review.Contenu: Very bad service, you can not transfer your sites if the account is expired, they don't remind you too, neither mention this in their FAQ. You have to renew your service and can not ask a refund even you don't need to use the old account anymore!!!

Review.Titre: Unfortunately
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately, Nikola N. wasn't helpful at all. He said he wasn't able to help me, even though his colleague helped me right away.I guess he didn't feel like working today.

Review.Titre: Best Avoided
Review.Contenu: Be prepared to be surprised every now and then when they ask for money for all things you might need to setup your website as the things they have promised have some or other loophole, they will jump to different topic to avoid to answer a straight question. Creating ambiguity is where they thrive in as it gives opportunities to sell more and more things and make quick bucks

Review.Titre: SO MUCH TIME AND MONEY WASTED
Review.Contenu: I feel like Siteground scammed me. I was offered services I did not need and not offered the services I actually needed. I ended up wasting money on the wrong services and finding out much later that it is nonrefundable. I still had to pay for the services I actually needed in order to keep my website active. I also asked for the website contact information for GoGeek Hosting, although it was never provided.The response from Siteground is inaccurate as I stated before. I feel I was scammed regardless of the excuses they try to use to cover it up.I won't be wasting anymore money on Siteground.

Review.Titre: Very difficult to contact
Review.Contenu: Very difficult to contact. Very difficult. Renews ahead of renewal. I did not want to renew, and they took money out of my account three weeks ahead of renewal when I did not want to renew. I shall take them to ombudsman.

Review.Titre: Not his fault.
Review.Contenu: Not his fault. The idea seems to be that you can perform complex support with one-sentence chats and automated chat-bots. No you can't! It seems to me a shame to have Boryana working hard to get new customers if you are just going to lose them because you can't or won't correspond by email. One day is enough to say I am not going to pay for that.

Review.Titre: Worst customer service ever
Review.Contenu: Worst customer service ever. Not only incredibly rude, but their grasp of English is so poor that the instructions on their website are impossible to understand. And thanks to their selfish greedy domain services policies, I have lost a domain that I had for 20 years. Thanks SiteGround! You people suck.

Review.Titre: Creamiicandy- I will remove this review…
Review.Contenu: Creamiicandy- I will remove this review once siteground gives me an answer to what's wrong with their cloud hosting plan which generates constant 502 errors recently. My website DOES not generate alot of traffic at all and I'm paying 100 a month after previous 502 errors and them telling me to upgrade all the time. Cleaned my database and tables and optimised it only two months ago according to their instructions but still throwing 502 errors. They told me it's because of these ip addresses accessing my website but it's still way under the limit of fair usage under their terms and also I checked those ip addresses and they are just your normal standard google crawlers and pininterest crawlers??? Your CPU limits my website just from normal bots ? My website isn't under attack, I'm well under the usage limits for a CLOUD server and yet the response I get is useless!!! I will be switching hosts if you don't fix this .

Review.Titre: The customer support is terrible
Review.Contenu: The customer support is terrible, and I spent hours fixing my technical issues all by myself. I have a hard time believing they are worth the cost.Regarding the company response, I have emailed them back.

Review.Titre: I cancelled my subscripton to the site…
Review.Contenu: I cancelled my subscripton to the site about a year and a half before it was supposed to be finished. They refused to refund me for the year+ of services I am not going to get. Review.Titre: Fraudulent company holding my clients .url hostage
Review.Contenu: This domain host is holding my clients .url hostage.  He requested to have the domain and associated email hosting released from Siteground, which normally is instantaneous - MAYBE with 24 hour down time.  Siteground ended up losing him his original domain, and still will not release the .url.  I have had to generate a new .url, which affects his business, until Siteground gets aroudn to sending an EPP code to my client, which they refuse to do.  I have had to use my valuable time to work around this critical .url problem by redirecting our new (third) .url to the Siteground hosted .url, and they dismantled that redirect DNS on purpose, so now all instances of the site are down.  I should add that my client is in the security and protection industry.  This is not an eCommerce site, but a CRITICAL service.  I have no idea where Siteground gets the nerve to continually blow him off and hold his .url hostage to try and keep him as a customer.  Youd think they would be somewhat intimidated, or at least respectful.  This is a man with a business that saves lives, and a site thay took 4 months to complete.  Siteground is an absolutely corrupt company with appalling conduct.  This has been going on for a year before I even came on board as a site designer, so there is nothing they can say.  To SiteGground: Release my clients .url within 24 hours or I will contact the BBB, The Bureau of Consumer Protection, and every regulatory agency at my disposal on behalf of my client.

But then customer service got angry saying we cant transfer your site from 1 plan to another attacking me saying i was a cheat trying to cheat the system and its only for new customers.  She attacked me, lied , said siteground cant even transfer a plan (ye right) and other insults to me.  Only new customers get discounts i was told, 7 year loyal customers get the price jacked up every year.  I was paying $55 for a simple 40 GB plan and wanted to charge me even more for using 41 GB. I got a similar plan for $10 elsewhere for 120 GB.  No more constant harassment emails to upgrade thank God.  I could list another 20 bad experiences I had in 7 years but we would be here all day. Rip off pricing and very poor customer service.  They constantly try and increase your pricing as they assume you too lazy to switch hosts.  Just keep away and don't get trapped like I did.  They only want to milk you for as much money as they can once you sign up with them.

Review.Titre: Truly deceptive renewal process
Review.Contenu: Truly deceptive renewal process. Avoid this service—it's among the most expensive web hosts, they've reduced functionality (removing common tools like cPanel and walling you into their home-grown tools), and offer little more than what competitors provide.

Review.Titre: Worst experience with a hosting provider i ever had…
Review.Contenu: Had a reseller account and i kept experiencing issues with microseconds or whatever other metrics they use to limit usage. So each time their limit was reached, all of my websites went down until the end of the month. Going back to hostgator, at least there you can set a bandwidth limit on your reseller accounts, and when that is reached, only one website goes down. Never again on siteground.Update:14/06I have been a developer for 15 years and this microseconds policy is the worst thing i ever experienced. And of course something that is never mentioned in the pricing/features. So after am done transferring 15 websites and spending countless hours on this, am faced with this limitation. And this is something that you cant do anything about. So at the 10th of month all my websites are down and i get a message that they will be up at the end of month. At least with bandwidth you have a metric that you can deal with and do something to fix the issue, like optimizing images, or assigning more bandwidth to the problematic website. Maybe you should take a look at what your competitors are doing(hostgator). When a website reaches the bandwidth limit on a reseller account, that one only goes down, and then you can assign more bandwidth to it in order to bring it back up. With your microseconds policy i cant do anything to resolve this. My websites are kept hostage, and the only solution is to pay more in order to upgrade my account. Really disappointed

Review.Titre: Renewal fees are 4 times more expensive!
Review.Contenu: 4x more expensive plans for existing customer. You have no value, we need new customers! The renewal fee is $479 to you but $95 to the new customer!!!!!!!!

Three items...Backstory: We moved out Sites AND Domains to SiteGround... pretty straight forward and easy.  We were on the GrowBig plan with four sites at only 4-5GB of space used of the 20GB allowed.Issue 1: We ran into a db problem trying to setup an Amazon Affiliate store... too many items in the db, which caused us to hit a limit and the site got throttled.  Had to request a 1-time exception without upgrading to get the db below it's site restriction.  Scraped those plans because the host plan couldn't support it... moved to another host.Issue 2: We have another site which pulls in data.  All sites were only using 3-4GB of space; however, SG keep saying we were at our 20GB max and throttled our site.  When the site gets throttled, you lose access to a lot of site tools (other than File Manager) to make SLOW file changes.  If you don't have SSH/FTP accounts setup prior, you can't create them after the throttle is in place to fix stuff.  Anyway, did a chat with tier-1... they in-turn did a ticket to advanced support (tier-2), who in-turn... basically stated that we are at 20 of 20GB... need to upgrade.  Okay, I spent another $300 to upgrade.  Called support (tier-1) back... only to get a better tech, who advised that our TEMP space was taking up 17GB of space and the only way to clear it was via SSH, which is why we couldn't see the usage via the SG web console.  We deleted all the temp files... space return to the normal 3-4GB of usage.  So, now the problem was fixed, didn't need to upgrade to the 40GB of storage... lets downgrade the plan back to 20GB.  NO refund... money spent gets assigned to the current plan, which extended our term by 1-year.  The only way to get a refund is to cancel the account.  Okay... migration in process.3. When we moved our sites over to SG, we also moved our domains to "SiteGround"... didn't realize that SG partners with Tucows (horrible domain registrar; go read those reviews)... so now, we are at risk of losing our refund (by cancelling within 30-days)... because our domains haven't transferred out.- I'll defiantly give the tier-1 folks at SG some credit for responding within 5-mins; however, this crap of upgrade, oh, you really didn't need to, but we can't give a refund... you have to cancel to get it... major crap.Win/Win, it looks like being forced to find another web host (Host-----.com) provider may be working out to our benefit.  We might be paying a little more; however, we are getting Cloud Hosting (Cloud Startup) for 4-years, 200GB SSD, Unlimited BW, 3GB RAM.

Review.Titre: Stay AWAY from Steground
Review.Contenu: We currently have about 30 websites hosted with Siteground. By the end of 2023, we will gradually transfer all of them away from Siteground. Their "Support" is essentially a grift to always have you upgrade to a higher-paying service. They do not allow you to back up your emails in bulk. The system they use allows you to only backup one email received at a time. Meaning if you have 1000 emails, you will click and export 1000x to back them up and then click and Import 1000x. Also, if you are hosting multiple websites on a bulk hosting account PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM STEGROUND. You will end up with 40 GB of space but you will only use about 12 GB of it as they use a made-up INODES policy which runs up fast on your account thus preventing you from using the rest of your 28GB. They are not really giving you 40GB as they promised. They use INODES to force you to keep signing up for higher services. Siteground is the most notorious grifting platform and provider we have ever used. We are moving away by the end of 2023. I have all the transcripts of how they confidently grift you and feel justified doing it. STAY AWAY if you have multiple websites you are hosting. You will REGRET IT!

Review.Titre: My Regret Over Recommending SiteGround and Its Impact on My Client's Project: A Costly Decision
Review.Contenu: I want to express my deep regret over recommending SiteGround as the hosting provider for my client's project. The experience we've had has been disappointing and has significantly impacted the project's development.The main issue we've faced is SiteGround's incompatibility with PHP 8.1 in the Command Line Interface (CLI) environment. This limitation has created a series of obstacles that have prevented us from using essential tools such as Composer and WP CLI with Continuous Deployment (CD). The inability to work with PHP 8.1 in CLI has slowed down development, affected the team's productivity, and resulted in considerable dissatisfaction from my client.Despite opening several support tickets, SiteGround has been unable to provide a satisfactory solution to this technical limitation. The support team has been slow to respond and, unfortunately, has not offered an option to select the PHP version in CLI that we need for the project.The negative impact of this situation has been significant, and regrettably, I am now responsible for covering the cost of a year's hosting with Webdock.io as we will be migrating the project to their platform. Despite being a costly decision, it is necessary to ensure that the project progresses effectively and meets my client's needs.In contrast to SiteGround, I have had a more positive experience with Webdock.io. Their team has shown a proactive approach and provided effective technical support that has helped resolve the issues we encountered. The ability to work with PHP 8.1 in CLI has been crucial in improving team productivity and recovering the lost time due to the previous technical limitations.In conclusion, my experience with SiteGround has been disheartening, and I deeply regret recommending them for my client's project. The incompatibility with PHP 8.1 in CLI and the lack of effective solutions from the support team have negatively impacted the project's development and generated dissatisfaction for both myself and my client. The migration to Webdock.io was a necessary, albeit costly, decision, but it has proven to be a more suitable and reliable solution for our technical needs. Moving forward, I will be more cautious when recommending hosting providers and ensure they can adequately meet the specific technical requirements of each project before making any recommendations.

Review.Contenu: I have been a Siteground customer for the last 5 years. I always had a good experiences with their customer service and the back end is easy to navigate. However, I've been struggling with my websites running very slow no matter how much I tinker with the suggested improvements. When my renewal came around this year, I also discovered that they're outrageously expensive! I just paid less for 4 years of hosting with my new company than I would have paid for 1 year with Siteground. There's a vast improvement in my website speed right after the transfer, no more tinkering needed. I'm happy to have found better and more affordable services on the market.

Review.Titre: Not an adequate and reliable hosting provider
Review.Contenu: While they provide adequate tools for running websites, their transparency with clients upon signing up for their hosting packages is lacking. There is no information available regarding the limits or allocated inode amounts. Once you approach approximately 79% of these limits, they block email delivery. Furthermore, accessing customer service is cumbersome, and their reliability is questionable. I do not recommend their services and would not consider using them again. Just waiting for my early subscription to finish so I can get move on.

Review.Titre: Do not believe the sales pitch
Review.Contenu: Do not believe the sales pitch. Little at SiteGround is what is claims to be. I have been trying to move several sites and associated email addresses from A2Hosting to Siteground. The automated services do not work or only work inconsistently.  The Wordpress Migrator did not work. The Email Migrator is hit and miss; it mostly does not work.When setting up a domain be VERY careful about what server location you select. That needs to be done via a tiny pull down button at the top the set up page. If you don't see that, changing that will cost you $7.99 - too bad so sad, "nothing we can do about that"Be clear that SiteGround will only transfer one site from another provider. Consider that when transferring from elsewhere. I knew that, asked about it, but was told it the automated WP transfer works 99% of the time. For me it DID NOT work 100% of the time.Attempting to get assistance is an exercise in frustration. Firstly one needs to navigate through a sequence of bot driven pages before finding a link to real person. Secondly, the first line staff, whether on the phone (my very latest experience) or chat appear to be trained to do the following: 1) leave the chat ASAP - one needs to beg them, repeatedly to stay online (& they still often will not) 2) direct you one or another of SG's help pages (as the bots do), in other words to make service a DIY experience 3) act as a praetorian guard: do what they can to NOT move issues to a senior (more competent level of support).I've given a 2 star instead of 1 star review as, once you get through to the senior level of support the assistance is much improved.

Review.Titre: Watch out! Full refund denied despite having cancelled ahead of very expensive renewal
Review.Contenu: I used Siteground for a customer and although we disabled auto-renew on 15th May, the renewal went through at £359. Requested a refund and they refunded £329. I didn't even expect to be billed, and was very disappointed that they just were not at all willing to refund the full amount.This seems like terrible customer service, unfair and tells me that their commitment is to their policy, not to the customers.I won't be in a hurry to recommend or use them again. This will loose them much more than it lost me. For the £30 to complete the refund, they could have had many recommendations.Sad times.- Update -Thanks SiteGround for showing understanding after this review and contacting your compliance team. I only wish I hadn’t had to spend so much time on this.

Review.Titre: Update 6/18/2023
Review.Contenu: Update 6/18/2023: Refund not issued at all. I feel like I was scammed into paying for something I didn't need. When I inquired about why different members of support team have given me completely different explanations, my questions were completely ignored. From 6/4/2023: Quick response, immediate assistance and resolution of ssl issue. I had purchased a premium version of the ssl service, thinking that would fix the issue I was having. It didn't, so I contacted siteground through chat. I would have given 5 stars, but the unneeded purchase was not refunded immediately. If it had been, I would have given 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Can't talk to anyone on the phone anymore
Review.Contenu: For the last couple of months, I have not been able to talk to an agent. I understand the efficiency of using online chat and I'm OK with them. However, there are some issues that require a conversation, and a down site is one of them.

Review.Titre: Siteground member since 2017 but thinking to end their service
Review.Contenu: I’ve used Siteground since 2017. But for the past 3+ years, it is frustrating getting my website fixed. It has been happening on my website since Oct 2019 and still paid Siteground with the yearly plan despite not accessing my website and Siteground claims my website is “infected” with malicious content which never gets resolved. They always say the solution is Sucuri? A $199.99/year which costs more than my hosting plan. That is not ok. Siteground should be the one resolving this for free with the service plan I pay for yearly. Yesterday, I updated my plugins and my website FINALLY is working, so relieved! So I updated the customer service then “suddenly” after a few hours later it is not working again. It is already fine after the update and then becomes unavailable again?? I’m feeling there is something going on just for me to spend more by using  Sucuri that they are offering.

Review.Titre: Automatic Renewal and price increase misleading
Review.Contenu: Dear SiteGround Hosting Support Team,I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the automatic renewal process that was recently applied to my hosting account. I find the process to be unclear and misleading, which has resulted in an unexpected renewal charge on my account.I was not aware that my hosting account would automatically renew, and I was not given clear instructions on how to opt-out of the automatic renewal process. Additionally, the renewal charge was significantly higher than the original cost of the hosting package, which has caused a financial burden for me.I would like to request a full refund for the automatic renewal charge, as I was not informed of this process and did not intend to renew my hosting account at this time. I believe that SiteGround Hosting should make the automatic renewal process more transparent and provide customers with clear instructions on how to opt-out if they do not wish to renew their hosting account.I look forward to hearing from you soon and hope that we can resolve this issue quickly and amicably.Sincerely,Will

Review.Titre: Sexist mansplaining and poor customer service
Review.Contenu: Today's customer service was a poor experience. I have been with SiteGround since August 2022 and my website was running well then over the past 48 hours SiteGround disconnected my website from Google Domains and didn't even tell me. I had to discover it myself. I reached out via Chat and the first customer service person was very rude and even mansplained things to me that I already knew and was sharing with him because I needed help fixing their mistake. He didn't take responsibility for SiteGround's mistake or even acknowledged it nor did he acknowledge that I am a customer who has been with them for quite some time and the directions he provided were unhelpful and not at all fixing the issue. He kept telling me to contact Google support (which we all know Google doesn't have), but this wasn't a Google Domain issue as everything else in my Google Business was running just fine. This was a SiteGround issue that they were not willing to fix or take responsibility for. I ended up having to go on YouTube to figure out part of it then came back to SiteGround and thankfully was able to chat with someone else who was then helpful and patient as we had to reset my entire SiteGround website. I am a business owner who happens to be a woman. SiteGround very much seems to hire white men which is fine for them, but after today's experience, I am looking for a website host with a more diverse and professional staff who seeks solutions rather than sexist mansplaining and unhelpful feedback with no solutions. This was poor and disappointing, and as a customer, I deserved better.

Review.Titre: I have had a theme template installed…
Review.Contenu: I have had a theme template installed and re-installed 5 times. Maybe more. Each and every time the installation is done incorrectly and there is an element missing. I used to use Envato hosting which was a breeze and they were so helpful. I can not believe I have been paying 20+USD and spent a month trying to have a working demo theme installed. What a waste of money, and time.

Review.Titre: Excellent support very fast and…
Review.Contenu: Excellent support very fast and efficientNice site toolsMakes wordpress a bit easier to understandTechnical help is very friendly and always prompt however the price goes up too far after the first few months. Unaffordable for a new project to run without funding.

Review.Titre: Poor performance and support
Review.Contenu: Friendly customer service however they dont provide accurate or logical advise half the time. Also load times are below standard when I've diagnosed on gtmetrix, pingdom, pagespeed etc compared to other hosting so their performance is really not reliable.

Review.Titre: It was an amazing company to work with…
Review.Contenu: It was an amazing company to work with as everybody was always very willing to help. However, I needed to contact them today for my renewal and I saw a message saying that if you have a different question than Service unavailability or Malfunctioning of their tools and interfaces, you cannot contact them . I did contacted them and the representative was very helpful thus the 2 stars for the representative.I had to renew my hosting plan for now as I don't have time to transfer everything as it expires soon but I will transfer all my sites as soon as my hosting plan expires siteground. Good job sending away good costumers that have given you 5star reviews in the past.

Review.Titre: Near Impossible To Engage support
Review.Contenu: Aiming to migrate a website into my SiteGround service, the Siteground migrator tool stuck doing nothihg .. virtually impossible to contact support, either CHAT or PHONE=Before signing up , check out how to access support for yourself, then decide whether impossible to cotact works for you

Review.Titre: Support has gone downhill - SiteGround now hides contact info.
Review.Contenu: I have been a client for SiteGround for several years but they recently decided to hide ways of contacting their support staff by phone, email or chat. Their touting 24/7 quick support is now laughable. I'd really like to know how those who gave their support a good review even found out how to contact them.

Review.Titre: I am really tired of not having a voice…
Review.Contenu: I am really tired of not having a voice to speak to, I find myself resentful towards a company I pay good money to for a service and they can not just answer questions. We are not all technically minded so just explaining my issues in writing is enough aggravation as I may not use the correct terminology which causes confusion, whereas when you speak to someone you can have an exchange of words to get to what you are saying. Although the online service was good it took a lot of back and forth to get to what should just be a straight-out question.

Review.Titre: It's my fault for being upsold in the…
Review.Contenu: It's my fault for being upsold in the first place but the value for price has gone downhill for sure.Also offered Cyber Monday deals without anything saying they were not for existing customers and had to end up canceling (after missing any deals from competitors).Their shared hosting settings are supposedly for better service but couldn't even import a demo (never an issue on my other host).

Review.Titre: Limited DB size, watch out
Review.Contenu: On the shared plans.Good points:- good technical support- tons of extra features to improve site speed and reliabilityBad points:- limited space- limitation of the size of the DB (< 1Gb), which to me for these days requirements it is really a big blow- no real control over the MySQL, PHP versions to be used

Review.Titre: One of the worst I tried so far.
Review.Contenu: The hosting service I subscribed is not very expensive but it doesn't worth the money. I have huge problems of random changes in the latency (TTFB). And I learned in a blog that it is quite known for a while at SiteGround.I wanted to ask for help to the support but I have to pay more than 40€ to get an answer. Very nice.I didn't give 1 star because some features are ok and quite easy to manage.

Review.Titre: I had a simply problem that should not have occurrred.
Review.Contenu: The agent who helped me did fine, but I should not have needed help in the first place.  I uploaded an updated HTML file to my web site, but a day later the old version was still coming up on the website--something to do with flushing out caches.  A very long multi-stage procedure is required to do it.  Siteground should be doing it for me automatically.  I am not an advanced user.  Also, getting to the agent was difficult and frustrating.

Review.Titre: The technical support is unhelfpul and…
Review.Contenu: The technical support is unhelfpul and it's very hard to even get to the option of chatting with someone. It's like it's deliberately hidden.Once my site was down because of their fault and they tried to sell me paid support. It's just not reliable. But the site is fast, which is expected because the hosting is not cheap. But I will not host with them once the hosting time is up. Instead, I will go back to some premium namecheap option, where customer service has always been excellent.

Review.Titre: Unethical business practices
Review.Contenu: After receiving a confirmation email that says service will be cancelled on a specific date they charged me. There is no way to reach a real person EVER. Because you have a contract and they have your credit card number there is no recourse. It’s like trying to charge someone with theft who has keys to your house.  They are okay but not worth the money- better options out there which is why I was dumping them. Unethical business practices.

Review.Titre: The support is ridiculous
Review.Contenu: The support on dns managing is ridiculous.People here give random answer and they don't even know what their are doing.No thanks

Review.Titre: They caused the problem, then they fixed it.
Review.Contenu: I give Siteground only 2 stars for this incident.   They recently did an "upgrade" and added caching.   Unfortunately, when I did a page edit the cache did not work.   The agent quickly fixed the problem, after I gave a very detailed explanation of what was going on.   So I am glad for the repair, but I should not have had this problem in the first place.    Another example of an "upgrade" that made more work for me.

Review.Titre: I have cancelled my website hosting…
Review.Contenu: I have cancelled my website hosting with Netregistry today hoping for a much more superior provider. After reading all the reviews on Siteground it has really turned me off and definitely not switching over. Atleast with Netregistry they had a phone number you could call and not just message service. Also the pricing structure of Site ground is stupid. Normally the more months you buy the cheaper it is, but here you are punished for wanting to commit for longer periods. Thanks for the reviews I will not get caught and move to another hosting company

Review.Titre: No flexibility on refunds
Review.Contenu: I am not happy about your flexibility. This has nothing to do with Beatriz but about Siteground.No refund for a mistaken autorenewal....I have so many domains and this is first time it happens....if you would be a little bit more customer minded, that would help.And don’t blabla with Icann policy please.

Review.Titre: Good service, but other problems.
Review.Contenu: The siteground customer service is great.  However, we had a security problem: Our site is ecommerce and Visa insisted on a PCI security scan on our server.   It failed quite badly, and the problems could not be rectified, as Siteground would not do it, and our tech team were not given root access on the server.Visa therfeore insisted we move to another server, which we have done(Amazon AWS), and we are now PCI-compliant.

Review.Titre: Security problem
Review.Contenu: Our problem with siteground is that our site was hacked, and credit card information stolen.   As a result , Visa carried out a full PCI investigation and siteground were unable to provide the full security required by Visa.As a result we had to move our site from Siteground to Amazon Web Services.

Review.Titre: SiteGround's Frustrating and bureaucratic-type casual response to our website being down 3 straight days.
Review.Contenu: Response and support to our website being down for 3 straight days (still is as I write) has been frustrating and has been treated with bureaucratic-type casualness.  After following ticket directives that did not restore website, we requested/accessed phone support that told us to submit another ticket because phone support did not provide "technical" support.  After the useless phone call, got better support from chat. Don't have time to say more as I am busy getting my website restored.

Review.Titre: Extortionate renewals and attempt to hide cancellation info.
Review.Contenu: All good for the first 12 months but be very careful of dirty business tactics, your renewal price wil be extortionate and they have hidden an auto-renewal setting that is not easy to find. The hosting was good but I lost trust after having to go 5 levels deep to cancel billing.

Review.Titre: Not good for a Magento 2 store  as I am experiencing.
Review.Contenu: I am not sure how Siteground good for other CMS platforms. But not good for a Magento 2 store, as I am experiencing. With lot of standard expectations like speed etc, we hosted our Magento site at Siteground. But not working well especially if more than 3 people use the site simultaneously. My store is in VPS hosting which is expensive too compare to other hosting companies when we account the performances of server.

Review.Titre: I Cannot get support from them - Chat etc
Review.Contenu: I joined them two days ago. The site seems fast etc.But getting help or chat or email is impossible,It wastes hours of my time!!It did get a chat with Atanas V and they were great.But I cannot find the chat again.I cannot believe how so many say their support is great if you cannto even find it!You go round and round and get nowhere

Review.Titre: Payed Domain transfer going badly…
Review.Contenu: Trying to get 2 domains getting transferred I notice how badly they communicate.They let you believe a transfer was ok to a few comments later asking for a new EPP code.Then their IT personal can't open a .eml file because it's not a txt. All they had to do was change the extention from .eml to .txt

Review.Titre: Good initial cost expensive renewal
Review.Contenu: Good service and initial cost however 4x more for renewal. Will move away to cheaper hosting provider (plenty options), I wish I knew from beginning it will be that expensive to renew, would not bother sign up with them. We I signed with this company 2 years ago i wasn’t aware that this is “promotional” price, anyways moving to netfirms 29$ a year and no hidden tricks

Review.Titre: No answers to questions
Review.Contenu: No friction but simply referred me to WordPress videos on YouTube when having trouble building site.Did so but these did not cover what I needed to know. Also failed to answer specific questions that I raised. Have now given up and gone to Wix which is intuitive with more online help. The only thing that I can say in their favour is that they answered the emails reasonably quickly even though they didn't help. Complete waste of money.

Review.Titre: I was considering moving to Siteground
Review.Contenu: I was considering moving to Siteground. I am happy with my existing hosting at Bluehost, but would be willing to move if I knew the server response could be faster. The rep couldn't give me anything that was reassuring that my site speed should improve, just that "everyone likes it" and that I can just switch back if it doesn't. Seems like a lot of hassle. Guess I will just stay where I am.

Review.Titre: Support is still hit and miss
Review.Contenu: Support is still hit and missIt is very hard to send Support Tickets or find a Live Chat.You spend so much time trying to find it, even if you can..if they are busy they should just put a message up.Not take away all the links(I got a support ticket this morning, now its gone and they don't reply.)

Review.Titre: Go away! Nobody home!
Review.Contenu: The technical support is good if you can actually find it or access it. If people have to make YouTube videos on how to get in contact with Siteground customer service, something is wrong. I personally think they made it exceedingly complicated and difficult on purpose.

Review.Titre: Won't accept responsibility for their mistakes
Review.Contenu: If everything is working, then this is great.  However, when something goes wrong, it can take a long time to fix.  SiteGround changed some essential settings over the weekend that caused my domain to stop working (they openly admit they did not inform customers that this was happening).  This has caused me numerous problems and taken me the best part of 2 hours to resolve plus I'll probably have a lot more follow-up tomorrow.  The best they can do is thank me for bringing it to their attention but refuse to offer me any compensation or a free year of hosting for their error which caused me lots of problems.

Review.Titre: Not an easy review to leave as there …
Review.Contenu: Not an easy review to leave as there are lot of good things about Siteground. Customer service is excellent and its also cheap when you sign up. However when it comes to renewals its poor, the price goes way up, not comparable to the competition at all (Most of the others also have great customer support). If you wish to move to another host but renew the free domain that siteground offers on sign up, the cost is 33 pounds with id protect. That is just a con!

Review.Titre: No reseller option
Review.Contenu: After some research into a new hosting provider for my agency, I was recommended Siteground. I was very disappointed to find although they advertise a reseller account, you can't actually sign up for it, and there is zero visibility when this will be available again. Very strange...

Review.Titre: Will Not Help With CPU Over-Usage
Review.Contenu: I've been with SiteGround for about 7 years and am in the process of switching hosts. The bottom line: they will not troubleshoot hosting issues, so be prepared to hire a third party tech or deal with issues yourself. At the moment, my site is indefinitely down despite the fact I've paid for hosting. I've reached out numerous times, and each time SiteGround tells me "this is not our issue."  Apparently CPU over-usage is a common problem for SiteGround clients (and if you have this issue, you're on your own). I'm disappointed in this company and will not recommend them.

Review.Titre: Siteground had such great support…
Review.Contenu: Siteground had such great support before helped out with everything and then one day you stopped with that excellent support level... I feel that we should all get the option to cancel our contracts since we are not getting what we expected and paid for....

Review.Titre: Low-level Transparency
Review.Contenu: Low-level Transparency The customer service, in terms of speed, is amazing. They are very supportive. However, when I was doing my research on costs regarding building a site, the customer service lady said the monthly payment would mean no advertising on my website.It is worth knowing that this is not strictly true; once I  signed up, I started building my website with weebly. When I tried to get rid of the adverts, It wouldn't let me without paying more money.Now if I cancel with site ground, I do get my money back -£22+, so it cost me over twenty quid to find out something that the customer service rep could have said very simply in the chat. Bit gutted - they seemed really good.

Review.Titre: Renewal rates are a show stopper
Review.Contenu: Service is good, however the renewal prices are crazy.  I paid $6/mo for 3 years, and now they want $25/mo moving forward.  If you move here with an introductory rate, plan on moving again as soon as it expires.

Review.Titre: Siteground removed my site with no notice
Review.Contenu: I've been a happy customer for many years, but Siteground changed the profile pages so it's very difficult to find live chat help.My decision to change to another hosting company was that Siteground removed my site because there were suspicious files - maybe hacking.I assumed it was part of their service to protect my site against hacking. Instead they strongly recommended me to use Sucuri which then costed me $250. Only when I had paid to Sucuri my site came up and running again. Bear in mind, that my business is depend on having an online website.I have now found another hosting service, WPX, that also protects my site against hacking. And they are easy to get in touch with.

Review.Titre: Does not allow clients to download their own website backups.
Review.Contenu: This company makes periodical backups of your website.In order to download your own website backup they want to charge you between 30-60$. Furthermore every 30 days they delete your website backup without your approval. Second after my site was hacked, i urgently contacted their live support , the live help just copy and pasted messages and refused to investigate further when i told them their hosting security could have been compromised they just said : " impossible", basically i was left alone to figure out everything , luckily i have some knowledge and familiarity with website hosting tools

Review.Titre: No Longer any good
Review.Contenu: They have now moved away from a) CPanel and b) free migrations.  Service has also taken a big nose dive.  The response time is still fast but wheras before it used to be friendly and helpful, now they have a couldnt care less attitude.

Review.Titre: SiteGround do have good tools and offer…
Review.Contenu: SiteGround do have good tools and offer a lot of packages.  They are very expensive for what they do and some of the packages that they offer at extra cost, are offered as standard with other equally as good if not better hosting providers.  Though my client thought they had protection with their Site Scanner, the client had malware on their site for 18 months without detection.  Needless to say I have moved my client away from SiteGround now due to this and the cost of their services.  My client is paying less than a quarter of what they was paying with SiteGround and get more from the new hosting provider.

Review.Titre: Sorry to say
Review.Contenu: Sorry to say, time to look elsewhere, once were great.. but things have gone downhill. Monday I will be asking for my renew fees back and looking somewhere else  ... my site admin fails to work and they fail to help me  really disappointed...

Review.Titre: Prices nearly doubled each year for 3 years!
Review.Contenu: The hosting and customer support were good. However, prices nearly doubled each year for the 3 years I was with them and yet the service and features did not seem to be improving! For instance, I had very limited email storage despite paying over £200 per year! I did not receive any suitable notification/explanation about prices rising so much. Also, it got harder and harder to contact customer support - phone numbers and chat support tabs on the website seem to be hidden away and it took me nearly an hour to dig them up a few times. Having shopped around to see what else is about, I feel robbed by this company. I am moving and will not be back.

Review.Titre: Sales and Support issues abound!
Review.Contenu: I only had the service for about a week... that was enough. I first had many issues even signing up for the service and was asked to send a copy of my photo ID to them!? I refused, but they wanted the signup anyway and took my credit card number.  I tried to transfer my site and they told me that my support ticket was a low priority and response times were about 10 hours or more, and often in the middle of the night so I wouldn't see them until the morning anyway.  The only shining thing I can say about this service is that they allowed me to cancel and refunded my money without much hassle. 2 Stars is more than fair.

Review.Titre: Poor support with no continuity.
Review.Contenu: So I moved to siteground hosting and email. Suddenly my emails were being marked as spam. A big problem because as a very small travel business customers were not getting booking confirmations and joining instructions etc. It was a nightmare and we lost bookings. Eventually after being fobbed off I thought I've got to sort this out. Four days later, round and round with constantly changing customer service people who always wanted to start from the beginning, eventually it seems the email dkim had not been set corrrectly. Arrgh. As the icing on the cake Siteground support then gave incorrect advice about what I needed to do to move a domain - as a result I now have to pay nominet set up an account etc. Another load of hassle and cost for something that should have been simple. I wasn't on the basic plan either.

Review.Titre: 4+ years with a reseller account...
Review.Contenu: I have a reseller account with siteground for 4+ years. Currently have ~40 hosting accounts. I would have always given them 5 stars. However, they have since changed the dashboard and restricted access to crucial settings. For instance, DNS records are not accessible via your "Domains". Your "Domains" only allow you to change nameservers. Your DNS records are married to a hosting account. They say this is for convenience but unfortunately there are many situations where this becomes a serious problem. Siteground is forcing users to purchase hosting instead of functioning like an honest domain registar. DNS records should not be married to a hosting account. They should be managed via the domain.

Review.Titre: Reel you in with cheap offer before…
Review.Contenu: Reel you in with cheap offer before automatically renewing at a significantly higher rate. This may be common practice these days but still represents unethical and dishonest approach to business in my opinion.

Review.Titre: Used to be better, now they don't seem to care.
Review.Contenu: We recently lost all our websites hosted on Siteground UK servers for 18 hours. They blame the weather for this incident as it was too hot! Personally, I think it's poor design and lack of redundant equipment/resources that lead to such an extended period of downtime. I got a distinct impression that no work was going on out of hours to fix the problem and the situation was only resolved when the daytime shift started work the next day.Their Customer Service is non-existent, Their status page eventually stated they had a problem and not to contact them as they were aware of the problem.  Turns out this ruse was to prevent you from logging the fact that you were aware of the problem and thus they did not have to pay compensation for such an extended downtime as you never logged it as an issue. Their status page promised restoration of the services imminently throughout the 18 hours of downtime thus pointless. I've subsequently voted with my feet and moved to another hosting company which very quickly showed how poor the customer service from siteground was. Avoid.

Review.Titre: If you fancy customer service to be…
Review.Contenu: If you fancy customer service to be more than a dysfunctional ai implementation, look for another company. As a customer, you have to have extended patience XXL, while getting no A(I)nswers.

Review.Titre: Getting the 4 digit code was a real…
Review.Contenu: Getting the 4 digit code was a real problem...tried twice and never did find it.  Using text to phone was that only way I could get through...first unpleasant experience with SiteGround...

Review.Titre: Endless Problems with SiteGround
Review.Contenu: I have move my domains to SiteGrounds due to high recommendations, but after that I will leave the SiteGround on next billing renewThe some of cons:1. Poor Support, thy have fast response team but without help or solve issue.2. No cPanel for new clients, They offer replacement (Site Tools) instead the cPanel but missing too many features like search email account forum, arrange by quota or arrange by alphabet and more3. The email user can not create (Auto response message). The admin should do it for each email user.4. WordPress Auto Update with (SG Optimizer), is tootal useless and not working. I try install auto update plugin also not working and not allow to me add this feature5. and this is most important (Endless Problem with emailing in sending or receiving)

Review.Titre: I have rated Siteground with 5 stars before.. They were great.
Review.Contenu: I have rated Siteground with 5 stars before because the support WAS always there... They asked for the review after any support chat help. I was very happy before they turned off my support chat for weeks when I purchased a domain transfer service from Siteground, then I have never received the email from them and was unavailable to contact the support. This was very disappointing.Especially after I left great review everywhere I had a big problem directly related to their service and I could never use their support anymore.Now I have almost lost my client's website because they failed to assist me with their additional service that I have just purchased.Apart of that - no complaints, but it was quite shocking to see from the hosting that I have enjoyed and trusted.
