Review.Titre: Technical support off
Review.Contenu: Today is 11 June 2020 and you can't get technical support via chat or phone from Siteground because they say Covid-19 has made them get too many calls!  I have several friends who have hosting with other sites and they CAN get technical support both via phone and chat.  I find this totally unacceptable.Here is what their site says: word for word'As a result of the high load, we have temporarily streamlined the support process to increase the problem resolution efficiency and give priority to the following:Service unavailabilityIf your site, email or domain name is not working, please report it here. Report a service issue.Malfunctioning of our tools and interfacesPlease report bugs in our tools preventing you from using our hosting as intended here. Report a bug."

Review.Titre: Too many issues, support chat is hidden
Review.Contenu: Excellent speed and nice interface. Support is hard to reach but once reached they are very helpful.*Edit: Used to be a good hosting company. Not anymore (unfortunately).

Review.Titre: Force for payments
Review.Contenu: They force customers who just want to manage their domain in their system to purchase a hosting plan with a monthly subscription?! Even the customer doesn't need it.

Review.Titre: Less than satisfied
Review.Contenu: We are on a shared server and use less than 1GB of space. Apparently someone else on our server keeps using all the bandwidth so we keep getting errors.  After multiple phone calls and finding numerous errors on our log that prove our issues are real, the Siteground folks provided no better solutions. When we asked to be moved to another server, they said yes but then quickly provided several issues we may run into while switching servers and that we may run into the same problem on the new server.  They had a perfect opportunity to offer a better solution and didn't. So we have found another provider that did offer a better solution and are in the process of leaving Siteground today.  I hope someone of authority reads this and teaches their employees the Art of Customer Service.

Review.Titre: Too Much Shadiness, Definitely Not Recommended
Review.Contenu: I purchased a managed hosting package for $6.99/a month.The order verification process has failed. I contacted them several times, explaining politely my situation and asking for a refund.They insisted that my order hasn't been paid and we kept going back and forth for days.Still, nothing happened, I haven't gotten any refund - they kept screwing around, to put it bluntly.If I'd contact them again, chances are, they wouldn't do anything with my issue.I do not recommend this hosting provider, due to the unwillingness to help resolve my problem and the shady refund policies.The only reason I gave two stars is the live chat option.They may offer cheap prices and a good amount of value, but beware of them, they aren't the most trustworthy on the market.You'd be better of going with Liquid Web, WP Engine, Kinsta, or Bluehost, for that matter.

Review.Titre: Disappointing charge increase
Review.Contenu: Very disappointing that my charges went from £70 in the first year to nearly £300 in the second year for the same service. Beware.

Review.Titre: Siteground promised to be a solid bet, but…
Review.Contenu: Siteground promised to be a solid and safe bet for reliable service and fast hosting, but unfortunately, I was disappointed.Despite moderate traffic (~20k visits per month) and no "crazy customizations" going on on my WordPress site, Siteground was responsible for two critical 502 errors, that persisted for 3 and 5,5 hours. The customer service took over 90 minutes to respond to the issue, and after both times they revealed that the issue was caused by a misconfigured PHP thing on their side. I am especially disappointed that this happened two times. Furthermore, the sitespeed was not satisfying at all and moving to a CDN was very difficult. Furthermore i had to pay close to 100€ a month for their "cloud hosting". I did at least expect a solid performance for that price. After leaving Siteground, i know now that there are other hosting providers that deliver a far better experience (cheaper service, faster website).

Review.Titre: Great interface but bad servers!
Review.Contenu: Great interface, but servers is slow, probably he have a lot of user on shared,t wordpress loading is very slow, I can't open my website

Review.Titre: Service good but the prices for renew services are bad
Review.Contenu: Service good, the problem is when you have to renew the service, the price is more than 3 times higher, and the discount that they offer is little.

Review.Titre: the plroblem is this window asking for…
Review.Contenu: the plroblem is this window asking for a rating. messed up the whole thing i was trying to get figured out because that chat thread is gone now

Review.Titre: Inept and uninformed technical support
Review.Contenu: After recommending SiteGround to a colleague - based on previous experiences - I'll never recommend or use the company again.The problems began when we tried to transfer a domain from another company over to SiteGround. There were a number of delays and errors popping up in the process and, while generally polite, their technical support were incapable of fixing the problem. During the third conversation with a representative I was told that Siteground didn't support .uk top-level domains, which lead us to cancel the account. During the next conversation, we were told this actually wasn't the case if they were purchased elsewhere (which ours was).After several days and multiple conversations they still haven't released the tag registration, meaning we're still unable to use our domain.If you're ever planning on undertaking anything remotely complex with SiteGround - good luck.

Review.Titre: SiteGround email not cutting it
Review.Contenu: I moved domains to SiteGround 4+ months ago and have had occasional email problems since the first week. Three email accounts will quit working and then heal themselves a few days later. All clients (Mac, Win10, iOS) quit working together and magically function again a day or so later. The one gmail account I also have keeps working on all devices regardless. Logging into the accounts via webmail shows all the new messages that I should be getting. Of course Siteground says the server is working, so not our problem. But it is a problem for me! there is something not working between SiteGround and me. I think there are some bugs that need attention.11-3 update:I may have resolved the problem. Time will tell. It wasn't all SiteGround's problem but unfortunately, I needed their help to diagnose a really esoteric issue. Clues were in log files that are rarely looked at. No one looked there. Again, Staff was pleasent to deal with. Just didn't go deep enough. I still appreciate their help.

Review.Titre: I used to love SiteGround …
Review.Contenu: I used to love SiteGround and often sung their praises, unfortunately they have been lowering their standards for some time now. First line support via live chat are completely unhelpful (they used to be amazing and solve most of my issues). They are basically just chat bot who then assign tickets. Urgent tickets for my entire ecommerce store being offline take 4-8 hours before a first mildly informative response. I'm often made to feel like a fool as I'm told it's my website and plugins etc. Only for it all then to magically work again. I've been told so many different reasons why my site constantly crashes. All of which don't clear much up. I was last told the issues i face are down to CPU usage. So I increase the CPU and the same crash happens again. Do I really need 5 CPUs to perform basic admin tasks on my store?!  I have no faith in SiteGround anymore and i will be taking my business elsewhere once i have time. If only they could wind the clock back a year i would be very happy!

Review.Titre: Great support but too many failures
Review.Contenu: I have a dozen sites through Siteground and have recommended the company to my clients. Since the migration from cPanel to Sitetools I started to experience many complications. The day after each site was migrated, I noticed that the file structure for multisite hosting changed. This created many 404 errors and broken links. My second largest issue was a database of a subdomain was not correctly migrated and completely broke any SQL queries. Support responded with, "discrepancy between the cPanel username and database name generation and the SiteTools one". Most Recently, the Siteground default webmail UI was broken and did not let clients compose emails. The saving grace for this company is that I have always had a good experience with their support staff. No complaints on server quality as well. Perhaps if the Sitetools switch went a little smoother for me, this review would have been drastically different. After my term is up, I will be transferring to a new host and no longer recommending Siteground to any further clients.

Review.Titre: Great Initial Prices, Poor Renewal Prices
Review.Contenu: Great Initial PricesThe hike for the renewals are steep. Make sure you consider this before you take up a plan with Siteground,

Review.Titre: My problem with Siteground is its…
Review.Contenu: My problem with Siteground is its support. The support team took days to respond and provide information that is often confusing and requires advanced technical knowledge to understand. Siteground claims: 1) its "[Helpdesk] reply within 15 minutes on average and in the majority of the cases the issues get resolved with a single reply."Their first response to me took 2 hours 29 minutes and it was very confusing. I waited more than 24 hours for a second response and it still never came.2) "Our live chat is really fast and efficient. Our friendly chat representatives successfully resolve 90%+ of the inquiries they get."What live support? The support team stated "I am afraid that our technical support team is only available via our help desk/ticketing system" 3`)" For issues that can be best addressed over the phone, we provide you an option to call our experienced operator."I tried to call phone support but it requires a complicated access code system and is only level one. It is not real support.How did Siteground get so many positive reviews on its support?

Review.Titre: He/She didn't quiet understand what I…
Review.Contenu: He/She didn't quiet understand what I wanted before referring me to another link. Sounds like a computerize mind.

Review.Titre: Service levels have dropped :(
Review.Contenu: I used to be a big advocate of Siteground, and the main reasons were the reliability + excellent support.  BUT recently, both reasons have disappeared.  Site is down regularly despite the fact that we upgraded to VPS (we wanted to make it faster but ended up with more downtime).  And support level has fallen drastically. It's now hard to reach them via chat, and responses are slow and less forthcoming. Which can be extremely frustrating when the website is down.  Never had that issue in the past. I'm not sure if it's a change in their business model, but it's definitely a turnoff.  We're now looking for alternative hosting sites to shift to.... I actually feel sad because this used to be such a great company and I was really happy when I found it after trying different hosting services :([Afternote: So, we shifted the main website to another host a couple of weeks ago and so far everything has been really smooth. We got all the help we needed from the new company for the transition and it has been such a relief not having to grapple with site downtime on a daily basis.]

Review.Titre: It feels like being help hostage.
Review.Contenu: Not happy with the approach they take if a site is compromised. Most of the hosts will notify you and give you some time to fix the issues. Siteground will completely block all your websites through .htaccess.So if you are on a plan like GoGeek and hosting multiple websites, all your websites will be blocked.  Not just one website that is infected. Even after you clean up your website, they ask you to provide the followingRun an antivirus scan on your computer(s) and provide the results of those scans as screenshot attachments to the ticket. What has that to do with the website malware. The malware did not come from the local computer, it is from the old application or some scripts on the website. Give some time say one day or two to resolve the issue. Give 2 stars for the live chat response time and courtesy.Another thing is we were set on auto-renewal but the setting was for 3 years by default. We had no idea that it will auto-renew for 3 years. So you get locked in for 3 years. Every other good company I know of they will set up for 1 month or 1 year. This setting is there but it is hidden, you have to really look hard for it.

Review.Titre: We moved our Newspaper site to…
Review.Contenu: We moved our Newspaper site to Siteground in 2018 and bought a Cloud solution. We have a standard, updated Wordpress site: nothing special. Our number of users per day is below ten thousand overall, and less than 100 contemporary. All was good for a couple of months, then the issue started: site crashed with errors 503, 502, 523.Siteground informed we have IOPs problems: our application accordingly to them makes over 5000 IOPs and the server stops. This is basically impossible for our Wordpress, we monitored it also at high user loads and it's using less than 50 per cent of our 8 CPU, 10Gb RAM, 100Gb SSD. After 43 tickets, the problem is still present, more than one year has passed and we were not able to obtain any proper support from Siteground about it: our site continues to crash. Also: backup via FTP to a remote site doesn't work and Siteground experts told us to use SSH (but we need FTP). And also cache has issues, in random occasions, grey placeholders in place of images or old pages.We asked many times to be contacted directly by a support supervisor, nothing serious up to now. We do not suggest Siteground.

Review.Titre: Misleading Promo - but the rest is OK.
Review.Contenu: We were happy with Siteground at the beginning, but their Gogeek package was misleading. The package said "Free Professional WP Transfer" and it was unclear this was a promotion, just for 1 website, not the unlimited websites the package comes with (This has since been changed on the homepage to be more clear). I submitted a ticket about why we were being charged $30 and was pointed to a deeper page that had the fine print on it, not at all linked to the homepage promo where the text was. Fine - that sucks but we'll continue using it because otherwise it's a great service. Then I asked if the WP Backup and WP Staging was also only included with 1 website, as they are also "singular" which was the argument for the Free WP Transfer. I didn't want to apply it to a website if I only had 1 chance to use it. I was rudely told to open a new ticket if I wanted an answer to that because it didn't relate to the first ticket. It was 100% related to the first ticket - which services were included with our package as a 1 time trial or unlimited. It took him longer to type that out than to just answer the question. Terrible customer service in that case, but the rest has been great, so I think it's just 1 bad apple.

Review.Titre: First less-than-stellar experience
Review.Contenu: First less-than-stellar experience with SiteGround tech support. I asked for assistance in creating a downloadable archive of my sites. I explained that I had been following the directions in their help section (which lacked detail, had no screen shots or videos, and were not clearly written) and required further assistance. He replied by sending me a link to a page I had already visited several times. That was not a good start. It took me at least five minutes to get him to start explaining to me what needed to be done. Once we got to that point, his directions were vague, and he rather bluntly "corrected" me for not doing things that were not included in his instructions. We finally got it done, but I did not appreciate his "corrections" when either better online resources or more responsive and skillful customer service would have resolved the issue in about 90 seconds.  Prior to the online chat, I had been debating whether or not to renew my  Is hosting service with Siteground. After that unpleasant interaction, I decided to allow it to lapse, as it now has. Even this rather rude and less-than-expert tech finally got it done, but his poor customer service and bad attitude persuaded me to switch my hosting to another company.  Siteground used to be outstanding but both its technical side and customer service have slipped. I would not recommend using them.

Review.Titre: Avoid
Review.Contenu: Bait and switch price gouging makes this otherwise satisfactory provider a must avoid.

Review.Titre: Cost of 2nd year rises exponentially
Review.Contenu: Cost of 2nd year rises exponentially, that is by over 50% increase,so not sure of value now

Review.Titre: Chat support is gone.
Review.Contenu: They removed the chat function for support. Never mind that I host over 60 websites with them.

Review.Titre: I loved Siteground but.....
Review.Contenu: I loved Siteground.  Been with them for years.  I buy website space for £80 per month - where I can host as many sites as I want.  Their support used to be super excellent.  Always fixed the issue.  Staff so pleasant and understanding.  And so easy to access.BUT THE MANAGEMENT LOOK LIKE THEY HAVE IMPLEMENTED A NEW SYSTEM.  WHICH IS AWFUL.They have tried to make the support system as INACCESSIBLE as possible.  It is clear they don't want you to access their support - because the button is nested deep within pages.   Instead, support now makes you browse through help articles.  And then remove the "CHAT NOW" button.  In fact, the only way to get to CHAT NOW button seems to be "site is down".Seems like they don't really do support anymore.   They just provide lots of self help material which is lengthy and hard to follow. I'm thinking of leaving and finding someone else.  So sad to leave a company I loved.   I wonder if they have cut down on their staff and trying to save money?  Not fair on us who pay a good premium.I LOVED Siteground.  BUT NOT ANY MOREUpdate June 2021Seems like a lot of people probably complained about this.  Chat people are really helpful again and very kind.   And no longer just refer you to documents to read.  Thank Goodness!However, contact us link remains difficult to find for the newbie.   Once you have found it - memorise how to access it again

Review.Titre: Money Grabbing Tricksters!
Review.Contenu: I am writing this in early 2021, the pandemic and my web-design business has struggled hard to stay afloat this year.So, let's get to the point:  Overall, I was happy with Siteground, their service is up with the best, good hosting service with reliable speeds globally.   BUT, the big but, is, that despite the aforementioned virtue, I have to say I was left indignant when upon renewal I was expected to pay 3 times what I originally signed up for. Especially, when pleading to support for some economic leverage in the face of their 3x ramp-up and all I was told was that this was their business model, and I should read the fine print better.  Like words straight from a lawyer without a soul. This to be frank, is a stupid and suicidal business model; I much like others, would be more likely to return to a service provider that service was not so good a few years later under the promise of improving than return to a company that previously had treated their customers in a sly and untrustworthy manner.  Trust is hard to earn and virtually impossible to regain once lost. I would have been happier to have gone in at 3 times the price and not have an unpleasant surprise at the end of the first year and the aggravation to migrate to another host with a better reputation of ethics.Which motivated me to search elsewhere to migrate to another service provider which is more transparent about their fees.

Review.Titre: Unhappy SiteGround Customer
Review.Contenu: I’ve been a customer of SiteGround for around 4 years, so I think I’m well placed to leave an honest review of their company. At first their customer service was great and I couldn’t fault them, but in the last year I’ve noticed a shift in this. Sometimes I’ve been put through to individuals that are probably new and therefore don’t have the knowledge. They’ve also made changes to their dashboard which makes it harder to find the live chat/contact part (only a small thing, but it’s annoying nonetheless). But for me, the biggest issue I have is the cost to value ratio. I work in digital marketing, so I’m aware of the costs for other hosting companies. When I first joined SiteGround it was okay, I was on the basic package. But as I started increasing the amount of websites I was hosting with them I had to move up the different packages. I know that I can move elsewhere and pay less money and get the same level of service, hence why I’m looking to leave. When I mentioned to SiteGround about issues with live chat and cost etc they pretty much give a shrug of the shoulders. In addition to this I’ve referred a number of clients and friends to their platform - not anymore. I think they’ve forgot the one thing that set them apart from the other hosting companies out there - customer service and customer loyalty. Why should you pay more when you can get the same service for less elsewhere - and they won’t restrict the live chat either.

Review.Titre: Long gone the amazing support
Review.Contenu: It's several years I'm using sitegorund and I can testify that their aggressive pricing has finally impacted on performance and support quality. What once was one of their greatest strength points now force me to look for another host. The support team that once was able to reply in minutes now takes several hours to get in touch and when they do you really feel they are just rushing through your problem with no intention of stopping by.Time to move on.UPDATE AND COMPANY REPLYthanks for taking the time to reply.I would understand if the things that I'm trying to do are crazy intensive in terms of memory or CPU usage but if the 64€ Cloud plan you offer is not even enough to let me update one plugin at the time, there is something wrong for me. That is what I'm trying to do: update very popular plugins, one at the time, in two low-traffic WordPress installations with very few plugins. This should be basic stuff... but no, not anymore. Now I need more CPUs.I've never experienced any issues in the last years. Now, all of a sudden, I can't do the most basic stuff inside WordPress because my Cloud plan does not have enough CPUs to manage a plugin update. So it's either the performance drop of a Cloud account is so bad that it can't handle basic maintenance in two low-traffic Wordpress installations or the support team doesn't have the time or interest to investigate the problem.

Review.Titre: ANNOYING new userarea, CARELESS support, LOWER standards
Review.Contenu: I am a client of Siteground since about 8 years. I have many services with them, domains, hosting and cloud services. During the years they have helped me on several occasions and surely I thank them for that. Since about 1 month, since when they have switched to the NEW USERAREA, my life as webmaster become incredibly sad and difficult. Their website is slow, to be able to access the cPanels I need to click 4/5 times, often I am not able to open a ticket and their system forces me to go to the live chat, and wait 20/30 minutes, whereas a ticket could have been openen quickly and their support respond later. Now on several occasions I see their Spam Experts IPs cause emails to not be delivered. Sometimes I ask to a Paypal link and they send me the wrong link amount. I still think they have a great hardware/software infrastructure, however they have lowered dramatically their standards. Whoever released the new userarea though more about the coolness of the design, rather than how a webmaster with hundreds of services could use their tools. Another sign of LACK OF CARE is that when I communicated multiple times some bugs in their user area (i.e. you cannot attach images to a ticket - the url after a Paypal payment is a non existent url) they completely ignored my communication, and even the Facebook message told me that I had to open a ticket. This is so sad! Surely the pandemic issue has caused their staff to not be well monitored, however I suspect there is something bigger at the bottom of this company that once was great.

Review.Titre: Solid service with very poor support…
Review.Contenu: Solid service with very poor support and questionable security

Review.Titre: Customer Service Has Gone Downhill
Review.Contenu: Siteground used to be great, and I recommended their support to anyone. But now they have limited my support saying I overuse it (Last month did support 6 times because of quarantine, other than that it is about 1x per month). I am paying for "priority support", am receiving terrible support, don't get the "24/7" support anymore, and am treated terribly. I have raised tickets asking about this and they just shut it down. I understand everyone is having issues with the times right now, but now is not the time to provide terrible support to your customers who have been with you for over 5 years (and pay for their hosting 3 years in advance, and was going to upgrade to higher cloud hosting).Edit (4.21.2020): With chatting with Siteground, there has been a lot of unresolved responses in regards to this. Almost all communication with their support has been in regards to issues with their staging area, domain assistance such as bought domains not showing up on the backend and tech support had to do stuff on their end, wrong domains showing up in my staging area, and migration questions. So almost all communications was within their scope as a host. They removed the ability for me to have live chats, so now I have to wait hours (up to 12+ hours) for a response with "priority support". Both of my tickets I opened in regards to these changes have been closed on their end with no chance of reply from me, so I have to open up a new ticket (which apparently hits my account again for "too much support requests") to continue the conversation. Siteground used to be amazing, and maybe they will be again some day, but right now their support has been less than ideal, especially for "priority support".

Review.Titre: SLOW
Review.Contenu: SLOW, and the service isn't the best anymore.

Review.Titre: They took my livechat support away after i moved and finetuned my website
Review.Contenu: Hi there,First of all i would like to say that the servers and speed are great. The support i recieved was great as well up to now. I think it is only logical that a new customer has to do a lot of finetuning in the first month to get everything right. I had tried their cloudflare integration but this slowed down my site so i had to undo this unfortunately. Then i tried rocket cdn integration but this also slowed down my site so i just ditched the cdn. My website is still pretty fast so no problem there.Unfortunately i had a lot of questions concearning that cdn change. Then there was a problem with my emails going to spam. (turned out they were not getting proper d mark settings from sitegrounds end) I had a lot of questions but they were all hosting related.A week ago i had a new question because i wanted to park a .de domain but i could not buy it at siteground so i wanted to buy it somewhere else and move it to siteground. There is no documentation if this is possible so again i have a hosting related question and wanted to ask someone.I found they had blocked my livechat because i asked to many questions and appearently:"We change the support flow for users who tend to post exceedingly more than the average rate of all clients to improve efficiency. As this rate is dynamic we can not tell at this point when your standard support flow will be restored. Still, you are welcome to post any service-related issue through the special forms."This basicly means eventhough they promised me unlimited livechat 24/7 before i paid. Since i asked to many HOSTING RELATED questions my livechat has been cancelled for an unknow time....This is ridiculous if you ask me. If you promise something you should honer that promise. I would have never moved if i knew they would do this. If you value livechat support like i do think twice about moving your site to siteground.Kind regards,Dominic

Review.Titre: Room for Improvement
Review.Contenu: I know they have received good reviews generally, but I am giving only 2 stars, based on my experience, which indicated to me that SiteGround could improve a great deal by becoming more adaptable to the needs of its clients.Giving credit where credit is due, SiteGround does have attentive and prompt customer support. The staff are all courteous and reply quickly to queries.Be that as it may, I decided to cancel (thankful for the 30-day refund) due to SiteGround’s inflexible attitude and lack of adaptability to my specific needs. I simply wanted an email host, with a domain name "pointer" to a Wix site - easy. At first it all seemed to be wonderful. But soon after I signed up, I was disappointed with the apparent unwillingness to accomodate a simple and modest requirement of 10-12 GB for my main email account (I only have a few email accounts) with up to a maximum of about 15 GB in total, well within the limits of their data plan.I was told during the initial online chat with a SiteGround sales consultant, that I could indeed have up to 20 GB for my emails (given the zero data usage requirement for my website, out-sourced on WIX.com). Having been persuaded to sign up in order to receive tutorials and more specific information about the Site Tools and functionality etc. It was only after signing up and getting tech support that I learned about a strict 4GB limit per email account, and that a new "upgrade" plan would be needed to facilitate my email storage requirement. The suggested plan was ludicrously expensive and utterly disproportionate for my requirement, as a sole trader working with only two other full-time team-members.I am sorry the deal went sour over such a small thing, and hopefully SiteGround will learn from this as much as I have; full disclosure and transparency up front is better. I have certainly learned to be more careful and ask more questions in future, before I sign up to a new web hosting service.

Review.Titre: Great support, poor UPTIME experience.
Review.Contenu: We have switched since September 2016. We took the GoGeek plan and was unpleasantly surprised with the limitations of the unlimited plan. The CPU and memory usages are limited (per moment, per 2 hours, per 24hrs etc). They give you penalties by shutting your site down for the public if you exceed, or if the issue maintains they ask you to fix it before THEY make it live again. We have twice a Wordpress update, but that 'broke' our site and it pushed the CPU/memory to the limit. Once this update was initiated by Siteground themselves, but they still lock your domain. So this policy is clear. While the support is GREAT! Having the site down because they lock your site, is not a great UPtime experience. Especially if they don't specify the limitations when selling you this package before you purchase there services.EDIT: Response of siteground. The link you provided, I could not find the server section which details the CPU restrictions. But I tried to google it, but no luck either. I did find this other user encounter the same issue. I am not trying to say it is unfair, it is just something people need to know when they sign up for your. Article at shoutemeloud dot com/siteground-hosting-cons.html (replace DOT with .)EDIT 2 - 24 Aug 2017 after Siteground's update: Thanks for the clarification where to find these fine prints, was not straightforward. And it took me a while to find this page (comparison of all the packages) myself from your website! While some of the limitations are clear, the biggest issue that shut our site down was the CPU seconds. That pages clearly defines that we can only use X seconds per day/week etc, but I guess we are just unlucky to be assigned a very slow CPU. Without defining what CPU, every user might have a different experience at Siteground. And I guess unfortunately, we were maxed out and got shut down twice until we did a rapid change to our website. (Also for your reference, you can identify us by Invoice 36595, paid 23 September 2016). Please confirm we are a genuine customer!

Review.Titre: Continued Poor Customer Support
Review.Contenu: I have used a number of hosting companies as I am a graphic designer with IT qualifications, & design websites for clients. I chose Siteground after doing research online about the best hosting companies. I wanted a company with good customer support & they often fair well in this area. Unfortunately this has not been my experience. I have had 3 issues requiring tech support since joining Siteground (SG) 15 months ago. I have been dissatisfied will each support experience. Last week I needed to update an SSL certificate on a website for a client, the support staff were not only rude & unhelpful but I was given the wrong advice, I wrote back to SG asking for assistance but their help ultimately made the site offline for 5 hours. Once the site was back online it was damaged beyond belief. Instead of trying to assist, the support guy told me off for not 'creating a new ticket' even though it was his support that broke the site. That night after many hours of my time and a little help from SG, the site was finally up & running again. The next morning I checked the site again & IT WAS REDIRECTED TO SOMEONE ELSE'S WEBSITE. That's right folks, the URL was sending all the websites visitors to someone else's website. I contacted Siteground (after being told to start a new ticket ) & was told it wasn't their issue. I spent another few hours of my time & fixed the problem myself. A few hours later I was notified by the same client that her email was not working. I tried reconfiguring the settings myself but kept getting errors, (back to Siteground I go) I was told that what SG did the day before could not have possibly caused the email issue (!) Once again I was waiting for them to fix it from their end. I have the top SG plan, pay a lot for the service (or lack thereof). I am supposed to have whiz bang support as part of my package. I am currently researching a new hosting provider.  I have been disappointed up until now but I think the events of the last 36 hours mean I cannot possibly continue with Siteground.

Review.Titre: I found it difficult to find the help…
Review.Contenu: I found it difficult to find the help section and negotiate the various menus as the chat page obscured part of the screen and some buttons didn't work for me. Martin was very patient and realised what I wanted to do. It would have been quicker if I had been able to email the information I needed to pass on to change the dns address. As far as I know at the moment Martin has sorted it. Thank you

Review.Titre: Not what they used to be
Review.Contenu: I recently decided to transition away from Siteground hosting, and I believe it's essential to provide constructive feedback based on my experience.My primary concern, constituting 60% of my decision, revolves around the customer support offered by Siteground. I noticed that their support tended to quickly attribute issues to themes or plugins. The recurring suggestion to opt for paid developer support or the provision of URL links to articles I had already explored became a somewhat predictable response. Unfortunately, the quality of customer support, once outstanding, seems to have considerably diminished over time.The remaining 40% of my decision is linked to value for money. Despite the initial excellence in customer support, Siteground's continuous price increases, combined with a reduction in service quality, ultimately led me to explore alternative hosting solutions. Affordability played a pivotal role in my decision-making process.In the past, Siteground was considered an industry leader in service, but this is no longer the case. Consequently, I chose to migrate to a different hosting provider that aligns more closely with my current needs and expectations.Site speed issues and Time To First Byte (TTFB) delays, consistently attributed to website themes and plugins, miraculously resolved upon migrating to my new host. Even in the early stages of setting up the cache systems, my sites are already performing significantly faster. This revelation suggests that the performance challenges were, in fact, rooted in Siteground's hosting infrastructure after all.In conclusion, my decision to switch hosting providers was driven by a combination of diminishing customer support quality, escalating prices, and the discovery that the performance issues I experienced were tied to Siteground's hosting environment. As a user seeking a reliable and cost-effective solution, I found a more suitable host that better aligns with my current expectations.

Review.Titre: Little security for email
Review.Contenu: I give 3 stars after 5 years as a customer. The reason is simple. Minimum security for email boxes. Except for some firewalls. No 2-factor verification, no qrcode, no sms with code. So in my opinion my customers' emails are at risk. It is unbelievable that there is no stronger control. Hurry up and don't respond with the same chant. We will fix, implement, notify the department, etc. Do it now!!!

Review.Titre: Unacceptable price increases again
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer of SiteGround for many years with no problems at all. However, their price increases have forced me to look for another host. They have amazing offers for new clients but it seems loyal clients get penalised with these new price increases. They put the price increases down to new technologies etc but with many millions of customers I'm not sure why loyal customers have to pay the price for this. Instead, they should increase the price of their offers for new clients and stop charging existing customers more. Their service is great, don't have an issue with that at all. If only they would keep the monthly price affordable for clients that have been with them for many years.

Review.Titre: Cancelling was almost impossible
Review.Contenu: This site will renew a hosting account from 35$ (more or less) a year to $395/year without your being able to cancel it (at least without spending a lot of patience and time to find out where and how). The chat service was perfect though, so contact them for support, forget about using the support pages on the site.

Review.Titre: Been with SiteGround for a number of…
Review.Contenu: Been with SiteGround for a number of years, they used to be great but lots of issues in the last few monthsWe have 2 services with them and moving site from one service to another is virtually impossible With the new AI support, now that we are having issues with our site, we can't live chat to support and have to raise a ticket? Whoever came up with this ideaLooking like they are fairly good, unless you have issues, or very likely for this to have been the case last few months. It's not like we use shared hosting either, even with their top end service we can't get support anymore

Review.Titre: it has a database limit of 1000MB no…
Review.Contenu: it has a database limit of 1000MB no matter which managed wordpress hosting you choose. so if you have a large database which exceed this limit, this is not a right solution for you.Also it has a parameter called inodes, which limit you to have a fixed number of files in each plan and the number of your files can not exceed that amount.

Review.Titre: Upside and downside
Review.Contenu: Upside: The gentleman that was at the other end of the chat was extremely helpful and knowledgably. The issue got resolved fairly quickly.Downside: it takes WAY to long to navigate through the system to actually chat live or talk to somebody. It should not be that hard to and time consuming to get the assist that I needed.

Review.Titre: It's a great hosting platform but deceitful
Review.Contenu: It's a great hosting platform because it is easy to use with a lot of features. Unfortunately, they are deceptive about their renewals by saying they are set to expire, when in fact they are set to renew. Even logging onto the platform to confirm your service will not renew is confusing because it clearly states at the top, 'service set to expire on X Date.' Customer service refuses to refund you after they charge your credit card for something you'd already confirmed was set to expire. I don't like deceitful marketing. If you have a good product, you shouldn't have to deceive people to renew it.

Review.Titre: I signed up in march of 2023
Review.Contenu: I signed up in march of 2023.  I could not figure out how to host and build my website, use the plugins or starter themes etc.  I asked for a refund and canceled my account of 05/28/2023.   I was informed that I could not get a refund, but I could pay an additional fee of $229 to renew by hosting plan, which I never even used.  The plan I paid for does not expire until 05/2024.   This company is sneaky and a complete ripoff.   The customer service is horrible,  DO NOT USE THIS HOSTING COMPANY.Company responded CSR TihomirD reinstated my account and was very professional

Review.Titre: The person who helped me was nice but…
Review.Contenu: The person who helped me was nice but he left the chat before the issue was resolved and it still isn't resolved. So now I have to start over again.

Review.Titre: At first he was patient when I was…
Review.Contenu: At first he was patient when I was struggling with  screenshot.  What I didn't like was when he rushed me at the end by ending the chat when I still had some questions, that was totally unnecessary and I didn't appreciate it!

Review.Titre: Nice people, excessive prices, keep searching :)
Review.Contenu: The employees do their best but this is one of the most expensive hosts you can use!Spend some time googling "best low-cost hosting" and read some blog pages and compare prices NOT just the introductory rates BUT the standard rates.They get you in with the $3.99/m for a year, let you build so that its hard to move, then start charging $24.99/m ON THE YEARLY Grow Big plan... insane!Keep looking :)

Review.Titre: It is very difficult to find how to get…
Review.Contenu: It is very difficult to find how to get in touch. It puts me off even wanting to ask a question. The person was good but is multi tasking taking 30 minutes for a 10 minute consult. I just want to talk to some one in real time straight away. As you can see from my history I only get it touch for real problems.

Review.Titre: Im very disappointed with renewal…
Review.Contenu: Im very disappointed with renewal prices, they punish old clients and you have to pay triple

Review.Titre: Huben was fine.
Review.Contenu: Support by Chat was fine.Problem resolved.

Review.Titre: malicious code - not solved
Review.Contenu: I've been getting malicious code mentions on my website for 10 days now, almost every day.I am able to delete them, but cannot do that on a daily basis; Result, my website was taken offline.Daniel was very supportive and friendly, but was not able to solve my problem. 4**** for Daniel, * for the problem solving unfortunately.

Review.Titre: Remote Access
Review.Contenu: Please allow your team to take remote access

Review.Titre: My websites offline for over 17 hours…
Review.Contenu: My websites went offline for over 17 hours. I got an update that reads "We are happy to inform you that everything appears to be fully operational and all services are up and running." They weren't until 4 hours later. 3 stars is a reflection of the fact that they'd been a great company with almost zero downtime in many years, the occasional brief outage is acceptable but anything over about 6 hours means it's time to find a new host.

Review.Titre: SiteGround has gone down from when I…
Review.Contenu: SiteGround has gone down from when I first started with them.  Their support staff is still friendly and helpful but HOW you access them is now horrible.  It used to be that one could open a ticket and then go on about your business.  That was Nirvana!Now you have to dodge a phalanx of questions just to get to the two options of "chat" and "telephone", neither of which give you the freedom to communicate asynchronously! Their Site Tools is a pain in the rear (give me cPanel ANY DAY!).  Every link is javascript so you can't easily open up new tabs by dragging the link - again, making it less flexible and convenient to work with.  Collaborators is a nice feature but you can't help users with their email nor with domain transfers.  All of this would be tolerated if they were not so SLOW (and expensive)!!!  TTFB is horrible.  I used to be a fan, but I won't steer anyone to SiteGround anymore.

Review.Titre: Be careful with Auto-renew!
Review.Contenu: I am a customer since 2019. The auto renew option for billing was ON but it did not work. Instead of send us and Email of billing problem or auto-review reminder, they just cut my site down immediately and also changed my IP, so when renew was done, I had to change IP again on cloudflare what gave me a loss os 1000USD on facebook ads that were pointing to a website that was down for almost 24h.

Review.Titre: I have used the chat and also phone…
Review.Contenu: I have used the chat and also phone support and found it sometimes brilliant but also sometimes completly confusing. For instance I was told three times by three different agents that since I was migrating my web site from a local server I'd have to do it manually. This was simply untrue as I just used a plugin and it did it seemlessly. It was a Youtube tutorial that saved me endlessly gouing around in circles. Siteground desperatly also needs much better step by step instructions and more video step by step instructions, I aslo encountered other agents that were super helpful who seemed to have a broad knowledge base.

Review.Titre: can not reach siteground support. need help
Review.Contenu: hi. I need ioncube php loader to be installed on my site. I can't install a plugin because of it. but when I try to contact siteground support I get a message that (hosting server inaccessible). so i can't install the plugin I need and I cant contact siteground. now I try here and hope for a reply.

Review.Titre: Email limitation
Review.Contenu: I own a Startup plan since 5 years,The support is awesome, every problem was solved in few minutes.But....The cost of the service rising sharply and despite the price they are many limitation with the email services.The worst of all is the limited number recipients per email sent, 40 contacts only for the startup plan, is less than most of free email services.You have to be aware of this before to subscribe.

Review.Titre: Dishonest hosting. They did not refund money.
Review.Contenu: Dishonest hosting. They did not make money back, even when I was within the 14 day guarantee for my Cloud Hosting $ 100 USD per month. (Today is the 8th day from the purchase date) They adjusted their policies so that it is impossible to return the money for 1-month renewals.

Review.Titre: Your texts have failed someone you can…
Review.Contenu: Your texts have failed someone you can use your site from another country but Canada for example has a six digit postal code it’s not called a ZIP Code it’s a postal code and it’s six digits letters and numbers with a space in the middle three space three your webpage one closet a ZIP Code and two won’t allow a space doesn’t say Anything so you don’t know why you failed because in Canada you’ve done everything 100% correct

Review.Titre: I very rarely leave a negative review…
Review.Contenu: I very rarely leave a negative review but I would never use their service again. Offered to cover the cost of the domain for a year but the following day they sent an email asking me to pay. They do not deliver on their promise so I am planning to go somewhere else.I have now received satisfactory explanation from SiteGround and reviewed my feedback

Review.Titre: Where is the chat connection?
Review.Contenu: Over time, it is getting harder to find how to contact Help directly for a chat. Siteground is increasingly directing us to articles. If they don't help, you go around in circles. I finally fudged into a different topic and got a chat window. The consultant was very helpful. If only I could have save an hour or two in finding them.

Review.Titre: Average customer service
Review.Contenu: I am in the process of transferring away from BlueHost to SiteGround -and I'm really feeling nervous about it. Their customer service / live chat is so straightforward for SALES - but try finding the live chat once you're a paying customer! I paid to have my current WordPress site transferred - but I've been left to do most of the transfer myself using their 'help guides' that are out of date! Their support is slow and not proactive. I ended up messaging them on FACEBOOK before I found my way into a live chat (20 minutes!). The support person was helpful once I found her!

Review.Titre: Good service but unjustified Expensive renewals.
Review.Contenu: They are good but they ask for more than 3X when you want to renew and they justify this greedy abusing increase move for the reason of being good which is ridiculous justification because success is when you provide good service plus good price. So I decided to leave them for abusing badly being good. finding similar service for more than half the price was not a hard thing to do.

Review.Titre: Whilst once great
Review.Contenu: Whilst once great, over the past few months things seem to be slipping at Siteground.Support whilst knowledgeable is now extremely slow, even when you have a GoGeek account, which is supposed to offer priority support.The new interface is slow, confusing and cumbersome, where before you could see all your accounts, domains, sites in one place, you now have to access each website seperately - where is the benefit in that.

Review.Titre: The hosting service is fast but that's it.
Review.Contenu: The hosting service is fast and reliable. The recent move to individual "Cpanels" is a step backward. Initially I thought it was good, but there are many drawbacks. It's difficult to move your mail accounts away from SG as there's no mail folder like other CPanel setups. You need a separate FTP account to manage each website.The chat feature, if you can find it, is good; but you need to threaten to cancel your account to get service otherwise you are ignored.

Review.Titre: The web hosting is great but the email…
Review.Contenu: The web hosting is great but the email hosting is really quite poor with little to no helpful information to get it working correctly. It's a legacy product which has been added to the siteground service portfolio with a dated 3rd party email client interface. The email service does not have any calendar functionality which proves a frustration for clients who view this as a standard email feature. Great having email, not so great if you can't book a simple meeting via email.

Review.Titre: What happend to the chat support option?
Review.Contenu: There a few support changes in the works that I do not like.The support used to be top-notch now there is no chat support available and you suppose to do everything yourself.Well guess what the biggest part why people joint your service was your killer customer support. You're cutting the legs under yourself by reducing it.

Review.Titre: The overall site is very user… awkward and difficult (Great customer service from Daniela T!)
Review.Contenu: The overall site is very user unfriendly and difficult to use, but as everyone is saying here - their customer service is amazing. Daniela T. was so kind and patient helping me, while I was very annoyed. Really great experience with her.

Review.Titre: Your attention was excellent and also…
Review.Contenu: Your attention was excellent and also the professionality of your staff. However it seems almost impossible to contact you by Chat. Now the talismanrealestate.com is down and I have not been able to repair it by restoring backup. Can you please help it and restore my page ?Thank you very much indeed !!!

Review.Titre: Hidden details about limitation on the 'unlimited' packages
Review.Contenu: Updated, improved the review to account for a refund on package that I cancelled. Their normal policy is just to keep the cash (so if you cancel after the 30 day cutoff, they keep it all). I had to persist and finally got the funds back.There is a limit on the 'unlimited' packages, proceed with caution.

Review.Titre: I got a billing issue
Review.Contenu: I got a billing issue. After 1 year my plan automatically renewed, however not the one I subscribed but more expensive one. The amount was over 200 GBP and I didn't need it, there was also no phone for customer service to call but I found a chat option on the website. One of the team members helped me to cancel this subscription within maybe 5min, I was really happy with the customer service, but I still wonder why after 1 year my plan didn't renew the cheapest option which I chose but more expensive one.

Review.Titre: Excellent support and solid tools...BUT…
Review.Contenu: Excellent support and solid tools...BUT beware of the teaser rate. When you look at the plan costs be aware that your price will hit increase to the "Regular Price" after one year. We went from $150 to $450 after a year. Downgrading is possible, but they state that the site will be down for 48 hours. We're going to stick with them,  but I would have looked a lot harder at the value had I understood the implications of their pricing strategy.

Review.Titre: They're decent for the price
Review.Contenu: They're decent for the price, but they somehow don't have WebP support enabled (or enable-able) in their PHP installation on shared hosting plans. You have to get an unmanaged dedicated server to enable it. That's pretty ridiculous considering it's a pretty standard image format that's been enable-able in PHP GD since 2012 (and with its current flag since 2015). I've not come across a hosting provider (except super budget ones like 97cents) that didn't have this enabled or enable-able (even GoDaddy has it enabled...) oh well.

Review.Titre: Expensive
Review.Contenu: I was a re-seller with site ground for 11years, Needed VPS or better because my site footprint was growing. Truth be told they are a dependable hosting company but I just couldn't get to their Cloud Pricing when there are so many top rated VPS services out there for 1/3 of the cost. Sadly I had to move all but 2 off of site-ground due to expense. I miss siteground and would come back if they had a Virtual VPS or a regular VPS for around $35-$45 a month with 50gig and 2 gig RAM.www michaelscottrizzo.com

Review.Titre: Poor support experience
Review.Contenu: this wasn't your fault, but tonight's experience with your Push-to-Live tool and Advanced Technical Support has been quite bad, miserable in fact. Enough to make me consider a new hosting service.to clarify the facts, the incident started ~7PM EST and wasn't resolved until the following day. i was on a 3 hr chat with L1 support waiting for L2 support to respond. i gave up but my guess is i would have been on that chat all night given L2's bad SLA.L1 did their best to help and were nice. L2 were the culprits. Not responding to a customer is a quite poor service experience.

Review.Titre: The person helping was lovely but I am …
Review.Contenu: The person helping was lovely but I am still unable to get into the website I am trying to see (cusacks.com.au). This is not my website. I am a customer trying to see this website. Why are you blocking this? It must be very bad for their business! Customers cannot see! Ridiculous service!

Review.Titre: beware of Account Executions
Review.Contenu: Account Executions are the real limit of this hosting provider.Sometimes there are unexplained spikes that endanger all the hosted websites. This forces you to switch to increasingly expensive hosting plansThe support service on the other hand is very good.

Review.Titre: No Nonprofit Accommodation
Review.Contenu: No Nonprofit Accommodation. Nonprofits are always in need of affordable online solutions that will allow us to connect with and support the communities that we serve. Some of the leading tech companies recognize this and provide discounted pricing to help the nonprofits (which are almost always running on extremely tight budgets - Microsoft, Adobe, GoDaddy for example all provide free software and support to nonprofits via techsoup.org). I was disappointed that SiteGround didn't have any of these types of accommodations to assist the organizations/schools that serve communities.

Review.Titre: Great Webhosting  / Email not so good
Review.Contenu: For web hosting Siteground are great. Been with them for nearly three years. My Wordpress eCommerce site runs quickly with virtually no downtime. If only my email which they also host was as good. They host the domain that the email uses but we seem had a few issues with email not being received by me or my clients over the last 3 years. The server sending my email was on blacklist once. Today they managed to cut me off completely because of some maintenance they were doing on there backend. Its just one too many email problems over a relatively short period.

Review.Titre: Worsening of services
Review.Contenu: Arbitrarily and under contract, SiteGround has eliminated the possibility for users to use the Softaculous software. Now to make a backup that was free until last month you have to pay 20 euros ... A disappointment.

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch?
Review.Contenu: The representative was fine. I strongly object to the bait and switch regarding rates, however. You have to look carefully  to realize that your fees will more than double after one year.

Review.Titre: Good service and easy to use services. Expensive renewals.
Review.Contenu: Good service and easy to use services.But they charge 4x more for renewal than for a new hosting package, which is just too expensive and forced me to migrate away to another hosting provider (to save 80% for same service level)

Review.Titre: If you cannot login you cannot get tech support
Review.Contenu: As a Siteground customer, two of my clients have had problems logging into their account because they can not get past the Authentication requirement. Either the email associated with the account no longer exists or they cannot receive emails (requiring tech support), and the phone number does not receive texts. To receive support to login you need to be logged in! If you call 800 828 9231 for tech support you need an access number which you can only get by logging in! To get login assistance you have to submit a form to compliance by email and wait for their response. They say it could take 5 days! What if the reason for support is because email is not working, then what? It is beyond frustrating to say the least....

Review.Titre: A bit dissapointed been a long term customer
Review.Contenu: Excellent customer service but dissapointed on how a new customer can get a much better deal than a long-term customer, that's not fair and makes me think about migrate my website to a different host company.

Review.Titre: I used to love SiteGround to bits
Review.Contenu: I used to love SiteGround to bits, but recently I had to move a website from one SG account to another, and the process was an absolute nightmare.Also, the new backend interface leaves much to be desired.

Review.Titre: They solve the problems that they created.
Review.Contenu: Site ground did a great job solving the problems that they created.I was unable to log into my website. My password didn’t work and I wasn’t sure why. Unfortunately, you cannot access site ground support unless you are logged in. Their password recovery system did not function correctly, not excepting the code that you texted me, and not sending me a back up email.I had to go through their sales chat on the homepage in order to access their support system. After I was connected with support, they were able to rectify the situation, Somewhat slowly.So yes, site ground was able to solve my problem, but the problem was created by site ground.The support personnel were very polite. They were not the cause of any of these issues.

Review.Titre: So Good - Until Now
Review.Contenu: The 24+ hours outage was not good, I assume its a one off caused by hot weather. Lets hope SG dont let us down like this again.

Review.Titre: Vladimir did an excellent job
Review.Contenu: Vladimir did an excellent job sorting out a very difficult problem or us. If it weren't for him, we would still be trying to find the solution. Thanks Vladimir, you're a champion.

Review.Titre: Excellent Tech Help.. But HARD to reach!
Review.Contenu: I've had sites hosted on Siteground for at least a decade. Always very happy with the service...BUT..... I HATE how they have recently (2020) hidden away the links for tech help chats or live person call.They make it super complex to get to the chat/live help and I actually had to write down the steps so I would be able to get the help I need when things go awry.SUPER FRUSTRATING!The good news is that when you finally do figure it out (and I'll put the steps below...) They are Wonderfully helpful and super easy to get information from!To access tech Help Access Code:Login  to your account>go to “?” >At Bottom, click “View Help Center”> Click, ”Contact Us”> Choose a topic area then> Enter info>then choose Call or Chat.> Receive code for callThen call Siteground, press #2 and enter access code followed by #

Review.Titre: Never buy the domain with autmatic…
Review.Contenu: Never buy the domain with autmatic renewal from SiteGround . You can't cancel it one the autmatic renewal actived, it's unfair for customer. SG is only the reseller of the domain.

Review.Titre: Seemed very busy...responses took…
Review.Contenu: Seemed very busy...responses took longer than usual and were not thorough enough. But seemed pleasant and professional. I called live support and they gave me everything I needed rather quickly.

Review.Titre: very nice attitude and initial findings…
Review.Contenu: very nice attitude and initial findings but cannot solve the problem and have to wait for further technical support. web service keeps down with big business impact.

Review.Titre: You was a great company
Review.Contenu: You was a great company, but your prices skyrocketting without no sense.As well, you autorenew the hosting without authorization and without any admin panel setting for autorenewal.

Review.Titre: Super slow websites
Review.Contenu: Super slow websites. My website took over 30 seconds to load. Even GTmetrix reported it.Seems to be a issue in my specific Node, but they never wanted to fix it .

Review.Titre: average
Review.Contenu: I think Siteground is overrated because its just a good hosting platform with great customer service. Sometimes my website can be laggy.

Review.Titre: Sharp practices hidden fees and offers that are not
Review.Contenu: I was looking for a new host and after researching found siteground had good reviews. I wasn't in a hurry and chatting with one of their reps I went away.. Yesterday I received an email to "Try our Hosting for Free" in which I was offered a one month free trial... After clicking the link I was alarmed to see that the monthly fees for the period following the free month were 40% higher than their non-offer package. Thus the free month was at a cost of £37.52!  I decided to query the difference with one of their operatives via the chat but half way through after I bought the operator back to the question he ended the call.The offer was clearly designed to get me to sign up, part with my card details and then to be over charge once the free month ended. Sharp Practice at its worst. So annoying...

Review.Titre: Update after migration
Review.Contenu: UPDATE:Siteground fixed their mistake and therefore I've raised the review to 3 stars. It's very stressful for business owners when a host makes radical changes that affect the website.  I appreciate their offer for credit and admission of fault.******Siteground migrated our site to their new site tools. With this migration they carelessly erased settings. Our site has been down a few times today. Certain apps don't work and I've had gone through about 10 different messages with their "advanced support" who just without a care paste a tutorial link. They were the ones who migrated our site and changed settings but afterwards they could care less about getting the site back to the setting that it was running on. It's careless and dangerous if you relay on your website for business. Today has been an absolute nightmare and I will be up all night trying to undo their changes. Stay away for now.

Review.Titre: Yet again
Review.Contenu: Yet again, awesome customer support. This time Nikolay T. He was incredibly helpful and patient. Always happy to be a Siteground customer.

Review.Titre: He answered my questions well @gabriel…
Review.Contenu: He answered my questions well @gabriel but I wasn't happy because of the rules or laws given by siteground to other region.

Review.Titre: One of the best hosting it was.
Review.Contenu: One of the best hosting it was but, Now they are only focusing on Fake Reviews and increasing their plan prices.

Review.Titre: 156GBP per month for a VPS...but no cpanel.
Review.Contenu: 156GBP per month.. fairly ok service, however it's missing cPanel.. I love it and I'm used to it.

Review.Titre: Temporary mail blocks @ live and hotmail if from Siteground
Review.Contenu: 5 stars if Siteground would have the mail blocks to Live.com and Hotmail if coming from Siteground, solved.

Review.Titre: I wish this was different
Review.Contenu: I wish this was different. I wanted to move my site over from wordpress.com to siteground, and was told this was relatively simple. I have been in chat with them ( all very polite and trying to be helpful though) for over 4 hours and raised tickets. They state the average time for a ticket is 15 mins ( that was 5 hours ago) chat is instant and (if you can find it as once you sign up the actual chat service is much more difficult to find) is almost instant, it took me three devices and over an hour to get someone. I am no expert in this but what i was assured was an easy process has turned into both a headache and a worry. Im giving them a couple of hours more to see if once  (if) it is up and running it is easier to deal with. It worries me as these guys are rated highest for service and thats why i started to move over. Will update this is it gets better, but not hugely hopeful at the moment. it feels like they have expanded quickly and havent caught up yet.update, the did refund, same day actually, so if you want to give them a go I hope more luck than me. I will up the review a little for that but the speed of customer service still is valid.

Review.Titre: Great customer service ..
Review.Contenu: Great customer service ... but I guess there are limits to what I can put on their host due to legislation.

Review.Titre: great service, but unfriendly policies
Review.Contenu: While having great service, I find their billing and renewal policies very unfriendly for ongoing customers.

Review.Titre: USED TO BE a great Joomla host, but not now
Review.Contenu: Support attendant was fine and cordial. Although he couldn't fix my problem, he passed it on to a senior support agent. I have given Siteground 5 stars in the past but I am highly disappointed now that they have discontinued support of the wonderful Joomla tools they used to have, moved from CPanel and gone to their own thing. I am getting ready to move around 10 sites from Siteground hosting even though we aren't up for renewal. It has gotten increasingly more difficult to get in touch with a tech support agent because they run you through a hundred questions first instead of simply being able to get to the chat button easily. Siteground WAS an excellent host, but now their "improvements" are sending me elsewhere. Their migration to their tools caused a huge glitch in one of my sites. I understand there can be problems with any new advancement working out the bugs, but  the fact that they have removed all the extra Joomla tools is the nail in the coffin. They have prioritized Wordpress and pretty much abandoned Joomla - other than simple installation. If you use Wordpress, you're probably good. But for those of us who use Joomla and enjoyed the auto-updater and other features.... I guess it's time to move on.

Review.Titre: Loved the intro rate but now that the…
Review.Contenu: Loved the intro rate but now that the full price kicked in I will be going to a new provider.

Review.Titre: SiteGround should consider empowering staff to make decisions "outside of policy'...
Review.Contenu: I'm not a web developer... so I discovered that WordPress has a bit of learning curve. In August of 2021, I paid for a full year of SiteGround's hosting service. Unfortunately, I've not been able to utilize it because I've been very ill - no energy & focused brain power learn WP and been unable to even start on my site, I intended to start 6 months ago. I need a simple, no-brainer solution, so decided to use GoDaddy's menu-based site builder... (a.k.a. Website building for Dummies). LOL  I asked SiteGround if they'd be willing to give me a partial refund for the hosting service I've never used... I only asked for a refund for 6 months, but they were unwilling to give me even a partial refund even though I've never used it.  I realize they have their "policies", however there are always exceptions. I've worked in the corporate world for over 25 years... there's ALWAYS an exception to any policy. Written policies are mere guidelines for staff without the authority to make 'outside of policy' decisions. On the other hand, SiteGround's chat response was fast and efficient... I give them 5 stars for that.. and the online chat rep (Silvia V.) was superb!  So, I'm going to write a letter to the COO and CEO... not expecting a refund, but suggesting they empower their staff to make 'outside of policy' decisions for customers... then, maybe they'd attain an overall rating of 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Just got off the help chat with…

Review.Titre: Not sold on them yet
Review.Contenu: i signed up with siteground after reading good reviews about them there customer service and how good there servers were. i can say i am impressed with the servers they seem to work better than my old host there dashboard and features are great staging and all sites are separate these are all good things. But setting up sites has been a nightmare first site i moved over couldn't  get emails to work the map and smtp just wouldnt work took days to sort out. in the end it was an issue there end which has happened with 5 of the six sites i moved across. then the email sending limits i had was 800 per hour and trying to set the email details in my mail client was hassle because something again wasnt working there end and stopped it processing this time it was cron job issue that sorted but then site blocked me sending emails at 400 another issue there end. the list goes on and on of things that are basic to set up taking days because of issues there end. if it was only one site this happened to it wouldnt be so bad but it seems to be the same thing with each site so having to spend a lot of time with support. Today its auto responders not working issue there end. i just hope that once sites are all fixed there wont be ongoing issues. Because i am quite happy with the backend layout its well thought out and has some great features if i didn't have so many basic issues while setting up i wouldnt of had a bad word to say as everything else seems pretty good
