Review.Contenu: Very good hosting company, but its Very very expensive

Review.Titre: I have to wait to solve my problem that…
Review.Contenu: I have to wait to solve my problem that I did not cause...

Review.Titre: I am a long term user of Siteground…
Review.Contenu: I am a long term user of Siteground hosting service. I really like their hosting service but I never thought I would write this negative review. I am giving 3 stars only because of previous positive experience.  Recent issues are overpowering my positive experience with Siteground. They suddently took away live chat and call support from me. I do not know if I will ever get live chat support ever again. I was informed that I use their chat feature too much because on non relevant issues. Since it is not safe to share ticket ID I will describe my last 5 issues. (1 being very recent and 5 is the oldest).1.  I have renewed some services, payment was deducted but nothing is renewed. Got no email. My ticket is still open and pending for someone to solve for over 12 hours. 2. Service renewed but got no confirmation email (They said there was a problem on their end).3. Found a missing feature in system that they said was there (They informed me they are working on it, I got no appreciation or a thank you out of courtesy for finding it). 4. Website was suddenly loading slowly without making any changes. It got automatically fixed even before their response.  5. My Siteground account design and everything suddenly got changed. So I contacted live chat (You can call it non service issue). Later I found out they have changed the look of all of their user accounts. I do not know if these are non service issues. I had zero complains about hosting speed and performance but this recent changes and sudden issues, live chat ban and slow ticket response is making me uncomfortable. I still do not plan moving my website as Siteground served me well past two years. I just do not know if I still am going to face issues in future. I am clueless now.

Review.Titre: Siteground used to be excellent
Review.Contenu: It's been few years that I'm using Siteground, I already gave siteground 5 stars on other review websites few years back but unfortunately today I can't, here is the reason why:First about the quality of their hosting: Excellent, never experienced any issue, you can trust the 99.99% uptime they claim on their website. it is 100% real.Second regarding the support. Until now, their support was exceptional. That's probably the reason why Siteground is so famous now, their support was perfect, live chat for the general issues, ticket for the complicated issues (their support guru are just super smart).Since few months it seems they hired a lot of new support persons but unfortunately the difference of quality between the "Guru" and the "Newbie" (as they called them) is just HUGE. Every time I had to deal with one of the Newbie, my problem was not solved or the information they gave me was even sometimes just inexact and the opposite of what the support guru told me. They had to take back my ticket and reply again.I tried to talk with your senior manager about this issue but I've never got any responses from my feedback, hopefully a public feedback will make things move because this new support is just killing the reputation of Siteground. You set your standards so high since a lot of years, I never thought I will one day have to write this.Still, if you're from a "normal hosting company", you will love siteground, their great quality of hosting and their support that has still, for the moment, a step ahead the other hosting providers.But please Siteground, do something about it :)Ps: If things improve, I will be happy to update my review to 5 stars!

Review.Titre: So far - no WP admin and no customer support.
Review.Contenu: I'm just going to paste my text from my complaint form here as I've already wasted over 1 hour on live chat this morning with no progress or answers:Please read conversatoin scripts on your system. After a lot of research and a promise of processes being simple, I have paid money for Gogeek (top level for WP hosting) and tried to connect my very first domain and cannot even log in to my WP admin panel. I was told last night that there was an issue and that the domain team would be given 'a bit of a push'. I’d receive an email when things had been resolved. I wake up this morning- no email, no progress.After 1 HOUR on chat with someone this morning, no answers. No domain connected. No WP admin. Guess what? I was told that they would give the domain team a bit of a push! I have been told there is an isue with my domain but trying to get an answer as to what this issue is or trying to speak with the domain team is as frustrating as it gets. I have set up and connected hundreds of websites and domains over my years as a website designer and never have I had this level of delay or confusion. It does not take this long to set up a Wordpress website. It is a 5 minute job. It should not need a team to take over 12 hours to resolve this. I cannot accept this SLA and neither will my clients.So I now have to wait up to 48hrs from registering domain to get an answer from Sitegrounds mysterious domain team and I have to wait 5 business days (so a whole week) for this complaint to go through. Which is completely useless for my situation right now. So this is my experience with Siteground so far. Not a good experience.Edit : I’m amending this review as the situation has now been resolved. Whilst it doesn’t give me the domain name that I need, technical issues do happen. I cannot blame Siteground for this. I do feel that I could have been updated slightly quicker than I was though.

Review.Titre: Great for basic shared hosting, but go elsewhere if you need a bigger server
Review.Contenu: Whilst on the shared GoGeek plan our website worked like a dream.However, our website is busy and we started to hit some service limits. Rather than inform us of this in advance so we could look at upgrading etc, they simply pulled the site. That's right, no notice, they just started serving a blank page and we got an email saying we were using too much CPU time on the shared system.We rapidly upgraded to a CLOUD based virtual server, and initially, for the first few days we were happy but then we started to get hit with regular (4-5 times a day) periods of downtime related to 500/502/504 errors.We spent a lot of time and money to massively optimise every aspect of the website, we massively upgraded the server to 12 CPU cores and additional ram, however, several months later this is still an ongoing issue.We have reached out to support over 50 times regarding this and each time they send us on another wild goose chase saying it's due to our site, cache or plugins and lately telling us our database is to blame.After researching the issue further I've found a LOT of other people having issues with their bigger plans and virtual/dedicated servers. They are simply unstable and not up to the task of hosting anything other than a pretty basic Wordpress website. We peak at around 75-100 active users at any one time and the crazy thing is, when the website is at it's busiest it can be performing perfectly fine, yet at times when the site is relatively quiet it is plagued with 500/502/504 errors and page load times of 30-45 seconds or worse.I'm currently researching other hosts and I write this review as a warning to others. Don't believe the hype. I'm not blown away by the service or the customer support and moving to siteground has caused irreparable damage to our business reputation and cost us thousands in lost revenue.

Review.Titre: I have hired them for more than 5 years BUT…
Review.Contenu: I have hired them for more than 5 years .. They are an excellent company. I have 2 GROWBIG plans of 480usd each a year with 50 sites between both plans. Today I just found out that for the same money they offered unlimited websites, they are now limiting it to 5 sites (for new customers). I asked them if they plan to limit my current plans in the future and they answered that they will not do it now, but eventually they will, of course letting me know in advance. It means that at some point they will "force" me to contract 10 plans of 480usd to maintain the same number of sites. THEY ARE CRAZY. Changing the quantity from unlimited to 5 and charging the same price, is ridiculous. I'm not renewing with them. Shame for them. They will lose a lot of customers, but it seems they know that and they don't care.EDIT after their answer: The operator explained everything perfectly. It's not her fault. Im just annoyed as how you changed from unlimited to 5 sites for the same price. I understand you are not planning to do it now, but I'm sure you will eventually force all your actual customers to migrate to new type of plan, and that means contract more plans to fit all my actual websites. Also if I want to contract new plan it's so much expensive, you force me to contract in a new hosting provider because no one can afford such craziness in price. And it makes no sense to me to have multiple hosting providers. I prefer to have all my websites in the same one. I was planning to renew for 3 years because of discount, but this kind of decision from your side gives me no trust for the future, so I prefer to not renew now, before you ask your customers in a gently manner to contract new plans to fit all their websites. You think you are the best, but you will lose so many customers this way, and you don`t care. No sir. Thanks. I prefer to leave now before it's too late.EDIT2: After my post they changed the limit of 5 websites to 10. Good decision.

Review.Titre: Sometimes great, sometimes not
Review.Contenu: Update 11/16/22: I've raised it up a few stars, but ultimately, I still don't feel my issues were completely addressed as I don't see the amounts paid in returned to me. I have used Siteground since 2015, and was happy with them most of the time out of the past 7 years. There have been a few issues, some I've addressed below, but for the most part, I would rank them as one of the best hosting companies. The issue I have is that when it's bad, it's really bad. For example, at one point they moved cloud hosting services and caused a bunch of slowdowns for all of my websites, and they didn't fix it until I contacted them multiple times and finally a tech figured out it out and fixed it. Another time, they removed my ability to chat with support, apparently because of the number of times I had used chat due to issues. So I'm paying for tech support, and am having issues (over 50 websites there, of course there will be issues) and in response they remove my ability to chat with support. Lastly, I had paid and was given a credit to the account but never seen that go back on my credit card. When I cancelled, I asked about this and didn't get a clear answer. Ultimately, there were a few frustrating experiences with siteground. I still find them better than most other hosting companies, I just think the service is spotty considering some of the issues I've had.Update: had issues, canceled, and they would not refund despite having 7 months of service left, and said that there was nothing they could do. Siteground was excellent my first 5 years of using them, but as of 2020, they have continued to go downhill. I have regular downtime with multiple clients, they never have an explanation for it, and despite paying for many addons, I can't even see them in the back end management tool anymore, and it claims they are "working on it." I have noticed a dramatic decrease in service, many issues, complaints from clients, and they act like there are no issues. I then spoke with a competitor/friend who uses their services, as well as a few clients who I am managing their accounts, and all of them are having the same issues. They take no responsibility and I have 7 months more of service which I paid quite a bit for and am looking to relocate elsewhere.They also no longer allow me to contact support via chat and essentially accused me of abuse of using their support system too much, but sure enough, I find multiple other reviews throughout the web showing they are doing the same to other customers. I'm not sure what happened, but they changed their business model and decided to change everything and I feel, as a long term customer, that I am being ripped off now. I definitely want to find another host and want my money for the next 6 months refunded.Update 8/4: Since my review, my customers are having more downtime and now all of a sudden, email is not working for customers and DNS info is changing on the server causing email problems even if my customers are using 3rd parties like gsuite or Outlook. All email forms use Google Recaptcha and is secured, yet now email configuration is not working, even sending email direct outside of a form. All of this has happened in the past few days since my reviews were posted. This is very concerning and causing massive issues with us and our clients.Update after response: The server was moved months ago, if there was a DNS issue, one I have complained about multiple times with websites going down over the past several months, why did your techs not notice it until now? Why weren't the old IPs not removed previously? At this time, I believe things are working better, but why did I have to go through all this to get you to look into it? This isn't just my issue, as I said, I not only manage other clients, but have friends who also do what I do, and some were using siteground based on my recomendation, and all of them are having issues as well. If this is an oversight, it should have been addressed and at bare minimal, we should have received an apology and private response. You didn't, the only way to get through was threatening legal action because my client was threatening to leave us because of the downtime, and to post reviews. That should not be the way to get through to a hosting company to get them to actually do something.UPDATE August 28th, 2020: They have improved the past month, I believe due to an error fixed in which they left old IPs connected to the account which was creating a lot of headaches, erros, slow servers, etc. This seems to have been resolved and their support has recently improved.  I will update again if this continues in this manner, in the meantime I upgraded from 1 star to 3, and will upgrade to 5 if the service remains the same over the next quarter.

Review.Contenu: Migrating site could have been simpler but crashed part way through, however a chat with support soon got it corrected. Once migrated and using the inbuilt tools soon had my site running as itb should have been. Having migrated from Fasthosts I have found the site now is very stable and lightning fast with GT metrix score of 100 & 99 compared to the old scores of 94 & 92. Review.Titre: A lot harder than it needed to be
Review.Contenu: This was a lot of work to fix something that apparently alerted as malware, but all of the scans we did showed nothing. The suspected file was set to not be edited, and the original footer from the original theme deployment. It did contain some links from the theme designer who we cannot find anymore.We ended up removing the theme and using a siteground theme which also alerted but then didn't. Weird tp say the least, but after a long process it seems to be rectified now.What does concern me as a very long time Siteground customer (since 2008) was the inference that its my issue when the theme came from the siteground library and has been in use since September 2008 without any issue. I also followed the recommendation last year by the siteground email to deploy the CleanTalk Security and Anti Spam plugins. I chose to pay for these plugins to have external support and functionality. The malware scanner within CleanTalk Security didn't alert on the same file as an issue.All in all a lot of work that didn't really help me, and forced the migration to a different theme that will now require many hours to make it function the way we require.

Review.Contenu: Great customer service and sales departments.Sadly I had to remove a star due to convenience. They tout having a superior back office that rivals cPanel, and having a WordPress migration plugin tool. The migration tool is poorly coded and adds additional forward slashes to file paths on some servers making it unusable. A basic function of cPanel is being able to migrate the whole of cPanel to a new host. Their "custom backoffice" obviously does not have the feature which makes the migration plugin fairly important. So I'm not happy with the premium I'm paying for a "custom backoffice" that certain basic functions do not work and require me to either pay them $30 per site to migrate them, or do it myself. I'm hoping the actual service overall will be better than my current host and make this frustration worth it.

Review.Titre: UI and support are great
Review.Contenu: The Siteground UI and support are excellent value for the price point. So much nicer to work with an interface that is modern,  simple, and straightforward. The 5th star could be awarded, given there was more support on the interrelationship between their caching and security plugins and other CDNs. I experienced many quite serious issues, and I felt the support/documentation could be greatly improved. After looking a bit deeper, I discovered that I am one of a lot of people who feel the same about this, and I hope this feedback will prompt the amazing Siteground team to work on a more productive way to help people configure these very problematic plugins. When I say problematic, I don't only mean what Siteground has developed but rather the complexities of the configuration of caching on the server level, file level, and CDN level. There are a lot of moving parts, and companies like Rocket and WP Engine do much better in proactively resolving any performance/security issues that come up. Essentially, on SIteground, although I got a lot of info during the chat threads, I have not been given any concrete guidance on how to best configure their plugins with Cloudflare APN, for example. Nor is there any detailed enough documentation that can guide people on what to expect with certain features active when it comes to making sure the site is unaffected. In a recent issue, it took the better part of 2 weeks for me to resolve an issue that would have been resolved in one chat support session on Rocket or WP Engine.To be fair, both Rocket and WP Engine are premium services at a premium price point. So, for what you pay for Siteground, I feel it is worth the savings if you do some of your own homework to support your communication with the Siteground support team. To be clear, although all the support at Siteground is very nice, people and, for the most part, helpful to the extent that you would expect for a mid to high-tier service.

When I went to "Help" I had a hard time getting through the FAQ links to an actual person.  I didn't see the Contact Us tab at first.   It was only on my 4th try that I managed to ask a question and select "Other" and get a menu of contact options.  I took off a star for this - maybe it's my fault for being myopic but I think it was a bit convoluted.  Ever option should have a pointer to where to go if the question wasn't answered.Once I got to Chat support, I had a great experience, my question was answered in 5 minutes and I got a pointer to the best documentation.

There are other competitors that have scored very close to SG server speeds at the 1/3rd of the cost. I will have to re-evaluate my renewal when the time comes later this year.

Once in chat, I felt like all the tech wanted is for me to leave. Very frustrating. Left without issue resolved (tech was submitting a ticket on my behalf).

Review.Titre: Inspired confidence though I did not get the technical answers.
Review.Contenu: I had a chat with a senior sales person. He answered my questions quite quickly even though it was clear he was multitasking. The answers were very technical and beyond my knowledge. However I formed a view that he was given appropriate answers and addressing my questions. The bottom line is we decided to use  the company to host our website.

Review.Titre: The person on the chat site was very polite and fast to reply…
Review.Contenu: The person on the chat site was very good with fast polite responses.  However, I was disappointed to learn that SiteGround had totally deleted our websites files.  I can understand if they had removed access to the files but deleting was a bit too much.  They had tried to contact one person who had moved away from our recreation golf group years ago but they did not try to contact any other contact on the list of administrators.

Review.Titre: Really good service - be aware of 'teaser' rates
Review.Contenu: Really good service.  I've had a few domains hosted by them for years, and have needed occasional tech support - they've always been prompt and extremely helpful.  They made the transition of my sites from another host absolutely simple.Having just gone through a nightmare of tech support with Network Solutions, I appreciate Siteground even more.Didn't really like that their posted plan rates were 'teaser' rates, but that seems to be standard practice these days.  Aside from that, I really like this company.

Review.Titre: Normally I am very pro-siteground.com.
Review.Contenu: Normally I am very pro-siteground.com.Today I am discouraged.Perhaps it's a Bulgarian thing but I thought we all had the same basic values, maybe we do.My email account on my server was shut down because they labeled my response to an "error" as spam. It was some smut email address error that fell into my inbox with 174 cc's. I replied to all that the address was an error and they shut down my account with the description of "large" (174) amount of "spam" (a reply to all).

Review.Titre: Good experience, but..
Review.Contenu: I just crashed my site, panicked, and reached out to support. V fixed my problem in minutes and got everything running smoothly again. Also super friendly. This was my first time using support, and I'm very impressed. Thank you!EDIT: Apparently I was just super lucky to encounter V. I've since realised that that was not a typical experience.

Review.Titre: CPanel => SiteTools breaks Multisite Domains & Emails
Review.Contenu: Bozhidar was very helpful but he did not understand the implications of the problem.  So when I did what he asked, it created two new problems.  He was able to fix the first, but the second (the loss of my email) requires an advanced tech. Other customers who run Multisite installations will be similarly affected by the switch from CPanel to SiteGround and all of your techs need to study what happened here.  Having customers lose their email is not OK.

Review.Titre: Patient, professional, answered numerous questions
Review.Contenu: I migrated numerous sites from another hosting service. I had issues with 2 of them--one because it was old and the new, standard, PHP wasn't compatible with something on my site. I contacted support and was on chat with Atanas P for almost an hour as he walked me through my MANY technical questions. He made sure I knew exactly how to do everything I needed to do--and was pleasant, professional and very patient. I have now turned over the 1 remaining problem website to the team to migrate for me, but everything else I was able to do.

Review.Titre: I would rate Veronika a 5
Review.Contenu: I would rate Veronika a 5, she was very empathetic, and understood what we were going through. Submitting a ticket is kind of a crapshoot unless it fits into specific questions. This was about the SG interface, and needless to say, that is not an itemized category, but I couldn't just submit a ticket to them without knowing exactly what category to select.  Again, Veronika was a perfect 5.0 Tech Rep. Very good.

Review.Titre: Good Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Although Siteground are one of the more pricey Hosting Services, I have found that their Customer Services are very, very good. Very short waiting time on the phone, staff very helpful and efficient. It’s refreshing to call up a company and actually have a smooth experience and have your problem or query solved so effortlessly. Other Companies take heed, customers remember good service.

Review.Titre: He tried to help
Review.Contenu: He tried to help. However, I believe support should include all issues the user experience once they login to their web-hosting account.  That includes server and any software, database, application, etc. installed in that server.  There are many ways to achieve this and very possible.  Honestly, I am very disappointed with this "Support" strategy.I have joined here for some reasons, and one of them is "Support"!!  One reason is down now.

Review.Titre: Sales Rep was grea But Sitesgound does not have prorate refund policies.
Review.Contenu: Sales Rep was great. providing all the information I needed. The one star that I took fo its because SiteGround does not have prorated refund policy which could help me quicken my buying decision. I have heard really great things about site ground. I wonder if you services are so great why don't they offer prorate refund policy to its customers to serve them better.

Review.Titre: Great help and the system is so fast
Review.Contenu: Great help and the system is so fastYou have to take a few days to sort things out when you migrate to Siteground, but you get great and friendly help from people that actually understand what they are saying. The loading time of my website and the speed of my mail have never been this fast. The panel is next level and logical above all. That gives me the comfort I was seeking.

Review.Titre: I was very well helped by Diana
Review.Contenu: I was very well helped by Diana. She gave me the right information when I asked her my questions about which Plan I should start with.Thank you and now I can start with the right website.Suddenly the line/contact was disconnected so I could not thank her personally :-( I hope see will get this message anyway.Br, LC

Review.Titre: Problems solved, but assumptions made
Review.Contenu: Siteground support has solved my problems. My only concern is that twice I was told to "get a professional developer". In fact, I AM a professional developer, but new to Siteground. Your team should not make assumptions about who they are speaking to.

Review.Titre: Great service and assistance
Review.Contenu: The Customer Service and the assistance provided by Siteground were great! There is one thing I am not satisifed with though, which is the platform they are using now. I find that it is not so easy to use, I need to think twice before clicking the button. I don't find it intuitive, at least not for me. Besides that, I am quite satisifed with Siteground so far.

Review.Titre: Not sure about the BIG warning you see…
Review.Contenu: Not sure about the BIG warning you see when entering Support chat, about what appears to be inferring "Don't use support" however, they listened and are going to look into my concern regarding Whitelabel client access and what data and what is available to the clients and how it contradicts the article on Whitelabel reseller hosting in the knowledgebase. I am, confident it will be quickly resolved or answered. Just hope it is the answer I want to hear. In the last 30 days, I have been moving sites to this reseller account which renews next month, so I am hopeful.

Review.Titre: I liked Siteground but something's missing
Review.Contenu: Well Siteground could be 5 star if it offered different data center option for the different websites of one hosting account owner. It states unlimited websites in its GrowBig plan so it should let me select the data center location for each of my website. Second thing is Weebly to Wordpress migration is not working so you have to do it manually, therefore their free Site Migration feature that comes with the GrowBig plan is not applicable.

Review.Titre: Very quick and helpful
Review.Contenu: Very quick and helpful, the problem was a loss of the webpage SSL certification which i thought might have been a renewal problem but reassured that all was well.  I still don't know what the problem was, but after tinkering with .htaccess all is now OK. A pointer in that direction from Peta would have been the icing on the cake!

Review.Titre: Made inquiry about connecting SSH
Review.Contenu: Made inquiry about connecting SSH. Assistant was very helpful, but admitted that Siteground was more attuned to MacIntosh than to PC, so help was limited. Did send me several articles that may help my progress.

Review.Titre: You couldnt ask for a more robust…
Review.Contenu: You couldnt ask for a more robust wordpress focused host. Backups, staging, updates, CDN, backend management - all top notch. Be aware the renew pricing jumps up quite a bit after promo offer. So if you can afford to lock promo offer in for longer period, do that when you sign up. Otherwise, the work around is to make "new" hosting service plans inside your account with promo codes and then manually make tickets to move the site(s). I havent done this yet, but been told by customer service it is an option.

Review.Titre: Great business but beware of late renewals
Review.Contenu: Great hosting service. Been with them for some time. I was however disappointed recently as I had allowed my hosting to expire due to personal circumstances. When I did renew 1 month later for three months the service was active for just 2 months and not three so effectively they charged me for the 1 month period I had no access to the site. I understand their reasons after they explained why... But I do believe that people should be aware that this happens so they don't get caught out like I did!

Review.Titre: Site Ground Hosting has pretty fast…
Review.Contenu: Site Ground Hosting has pretty fast hosting compared to other affordable hosting companies online. Although they do not offer phone support, and kind of hide their chat button for support, once you find it and get through, usually pretty decent service.

Review.Titre: The Tech was fine and helpful, New system stinks
Review.Contenu: The Tech was fine and helpful.  I really dislike the new Support system where I have to wait on chat or phone instead of putting a ticket in and getting a reply back later.  There's no history for past requests either.  This is a big step backwards for SiteGround Support in my opinion.

Review.Titre: Great service, fast hosting, knowledgeable support
Review.Contenu: Great service. As an agency owner, I recommend Siteground to all my clients. The only reason for the 4 stars is the recent downgrade in phone support. Over the last 12 months I've noticed that it's harder and harder to get someone on the phone or even find the info on the site. I'm sure that's not by accident. And while I could spend 5x longer researching and finding the info myself, I don't have time for it. I need quick answers and solutions. Phone works best for that. I did received excellent chat support today but my fingers are now bleeding from discussion. :)

Review.Titre: Moved from another host
Review.Contenu: Moved from another host, sales team was fantastic but slight hiccup with the transfer. Was told no downtime but lost my site for over a day which support then said is normal. Good speed tho, some extra free plugins for optimisation and free email accounts. Decent service

Review.Titre: Customer services is slowly being downgraded
Review.Contenu: The service was good via chat. But I see that their customer services are slowly being down-graded.  Before I could easily talk to a customer service rep with no problem and they would help me fix the problem. The phone number was readily posted on the website. Now to talk to a rep you have really dig to find the page to attempt to talk to customer service reps. I mean really dig. And now for assistance they give advice and directions on how to fix the issue. It leaves a lot of room for a newbe to mess up with do-it-yourself. Before they helped to fix the problem. It is not the Siteground of even a few years ago.

Review.Titre: Hope it helps
Review.Contenu: I don't know yet whether the solution the employee gave was accurate or not - he told me to wait a day to let the changes made be propagated - so initially a middle score = 3 stars. However he was friendly, so for friendliness he gets an extrafree bonus star = 4 stars

Review.Titre: In this instance
Review.Contenu: In this instance, they were slow responding, but it looks like they had their hands full for a few minutes... with a system-wide email rules problem.However, it is the first time I would say they were slow, normally they are GREAT!

Review.Titre: Great – decent treatment and very little friction.
Review.Contenu: SIteground is good and i like the many possibilities it affords like the unlimited sites one can host. The little friction is the limitation in the CPU Time Usage. I often find my sites (zedsoccer.com and askzambiajobs.com) difficulty to access at times as i would have exceeded the limit on the cpu usage

Review.Titre: fine but..
Review.Contenu: Kyolo was helpful in working with an administrator whom i designated to close my account.  We were disappointed, however, that outstanding reseller credits (not yet applied to any services) of $225 were not refundable.  This may not be Kyolo's fault, but it is an issue with the ethics of the company.

Review.Titre: Over the past couple  of weeks I have…
Review.Contenu: Over the past couple  of weeks I have been unable to log in on a couple of occasions. There are some quirky issues with Siteground the hosting provider, but support has always been helpful.

Review.Titre: Supportwise bad company
Review.Contenu: I have used Siteground.com for my business since day one and honestly could not think of any better company! Love it. Excellent customer service and an outstanding uptime on servers. But technical support is not good, so I am switching to LiveMNC.com. Now I am happy with LiveMNC.

Review.Titre: History of cpanel creation, modification, username access and viewing details.
Review.Contenu: The only concern is when customer is requesting to raise a complaint, then it should be raised at the same time attaching the conversation, the customer had with the agent. Sometimes from customer's experience there are knowledge areas where customer needs satisfactory information. My concern was a technical report about cpanel username that as per my IT experience was created more than once and I have no technical knowledge about it. There have been many changes since I hired SiteGround service till this date and I am now getting upset due to these unknown technical changes. Please check the history of chat. Thank you.

Review.Titre: Suspension and connection issue
Review.Contenu: I was unable to connect.  Unfortunately hte problem arose over the weekend.  At the craclk of dawn on Monday I got through on the chat line and received a follow up phone call atraight away.  Quick and helpful.  Good work

Review.Titre: Hosting is cheap and fast
Review.Contenu: Hosting is cheap and fast, SSL is free, ability to be an affiliate is wonderful - but customer service isn't always so good. They almost always sound rushed and want to get me off the phone ASAP, like they're being timed. That's my only complaint.

Review.Titre: Price Triples After First Year
Review.Contenu: The support is pretty good and uptime is good, however, when you go to renew annually it is at least triple the cost.Bluehost I have heard are excellent too their renewal price stays the same they do not add on hundreds of dollards.

Review.Titre: Service 24/7
Review.Contenu: The professional staff are always available to help, no matter the time, or problem. I have used both services, chat and phone support, with great success. I have even tested them off peak hours and in the wee hours of early morning with the same results, AWESOME! Only 1 slight hiccup for me; connectivity of the chat support and being disconnected after 5+min, but it's easy to re-connect and the next agent can browse your previous log. No, biggie, just an inconvenience that seems to occur. I don't know if this is just me, as this has happened twice and the reason I won't give a 5 star rating.

Review.Titre: Domain Addon Tutorial Edit
Review.Contenu: Great help. Domain Addon tutorial is missing a step, viz. "cPanel --> Security/Let's Encrypt", which a customer agent resolved. This will come full circle, viz. 5-star rating, when the tutorial gets updated.

Review.Titre: SG is what a human (and Non Techie) can expect 100% as "customer oriented services".
Review.Contenu: If you ever looked for a provider which services at a good prize-quality range, take SG. But more than the prize its the service itsself and the SG Team.  They are 24hx7d available, via telephone, via chat, via support ticket within your own account.... very quick answers, precise informations... and always flexible to give advices. For freelancers, for small companies by sure SG is what one can expect, competences in new technoloies, data security and all front ends very user friendly. I am using SG since years, having setup different domains and systems (mainly Wordpress Blogs + MySQL). Dont want miss SG !

Review.Titre: While I've been using SiteGround…
Review.Contenu: While I've been using SiteGround services for years, they recently decided that I don't need fast answers and fast solutions and now they reply my tickets within several hours, not several minutes like it used to be before (like they say "to meet customer's expectations"). Slightly disappointed because I especially liked their fast replies and solutions. Now I need to wait for my questions to be resolved during the day or so. Recently my mail stopped working because of the certificate error, I created the ticket and wrote its IMPORTANT, but nobody cares and they replied by the end of day.SiteGround, what problems are you experiencing?

Review.Titre: Expected better though
Review.Contenu: I expected that the issue will be resolved today, (since I've acted as previously guided by Customer Care), rather than my case being passed over to Accounts for review in the next 24hrs! Time is prescious!

Review.Titre: The customer service workers are great…
Review.Contenu: The customer service workers are great and serve the customer with sincerity . they may have some comments about the service prices, but customer service is the best thing they have.

Review.Titre: The websiet is one of the best hosting…
Review.Contenu: The website is one of the best hosting of the world and amazing for Wordpress.It is very expensive and the renewal of the services is sometime a little tricky, but the customer care is great.

Review.Titre: Did not resolve my issue and suggested…
Review.Contenu: Did not resolve my issue and suggested uninstall and reinstall the plugin which was tried still not working.Googled the problem and it seems very common but have not yet found a post with a fix.

Review.Titre: Give us the power
Review.Contenu: Service is very good but at-least allow us to change the value of PHP variables. Limits are very low. You competitors giving the power of changing the values of PHP variables in a shared host.

Review.Titre: Dedicated IP doesn't apply to outgoing email
Review.Contenu: Something you need to know in case you are considering a dedicated IP for your website:This is what Siteground support says:  “The outgoing emails are always using our spam expert filtering IPs and the dedicated IP won't' change the IP for the outgoing emails. The Dedicated IP will be only for the current domain name and website.” I have had other hosting before where I was paying for dedicated IPs but found out that my email was not going out under the dedicated IP for my domain, so it was being blacklisted because of spamming from others on the shared IP.  Looks like Siteground, even with a dedicated IP, doesn’t solve this problem.It's a shame, because other than this, I find Siteground to be fantastic - I guess they have to defend themselves against spammers by doing this.

Review.Titre: Impressed
Review.Contenu: Just had two issues solved in 10 minutes by their customer service team on live chat - very few hosting companies have that level of customer service, normally premium rate phone nº.Impressed.

Review.Titre: Prices too high in proportion server performance...
Review.Contenu: I have been a Sitground customer for about 5 years and over time I have had more websites with them.The assistance service is excellent, among the absolute best that you can find out there: via chat they answer in 1/2 minutes and via Ticket for GoGeek customers respond on average in 30 minutes.However I have found that the performance of their servers is very poor in terms of speed: both the loading speed of the entire site and in particular the TTFB are 4 or 5 times higher than most of the providers I have tested.While remaining an excellent provider, considering the prices of the packages offered on average higher than the other competitors of the same market segment and the poor performance of the servers, I do not feel like recommending this company.

Review.Titre: Excellent speed and awesome customer…
Review.Contenu: Excellent speed and awesome customer support. Overall, a pretty good hosting company. The only thing I donot like is that their pricing is way higher than competitors.

Review.Titre: Pre sales / Hosting
Review.Contenu: Generally polite customer service, suggestive but not pushy. I would recommend that when you talk about the price you actually include VAT in it. It's a really dodgy tactic that I don't like.

Review.Titre: Siteground's new change seems complex
Review.Contenu: Siteground seemed to me a great and userfriendly hosting site but the recent change they have made seems to me discomfortable (i now any new changes is like that) but they should have kept full and detailed tutorial in the very front page of its site so that the new user like me would not be confused. I had to pass too much time just to get them contacted with my newly bought user id account of siteground. seeing no choice, I had to login with my old siteground account and from there I contacted one support guy, Stoyan G and helped me nicely. But from my newly bought user's account I could not find any way to contact siteground. Any product's excellence remain on its users' easiness and friendliness. Sometime you should see yourself wearing the shoes of layman customer.

Review.Titre: the tech was great
Review.Contenu: the tech was great.  the only reason why it's a 4 star is because of the initial wait time.  even though it said waiting time was none, i actually waited for about 15 minutes.

Review.Titre: My experience with Gabriel P of Site Ground…
Review.Contenu: My experience with Gabriel P of Site Ground was awesome. He took his time to listen to me and knew exactly what I just wanted to resolve. He is the guy that knows his onions.

Review.Titre: The employee always very polite
Review.Contenu: The employee always very polite, good and fast service.

Review.Titre: Martin stuck with me while we trouble…
Review.Contenu: Martin stuck with me while we trouble shoot a weird PHP version issue. In the end I was able to figure out how to get my site working again. Siteground support is always polite and persistent.

Review.Titre: I'm still working on it
Review.Contenu: I'm still working on it. Talk later.

Review.Titre: Great support
Review.Contenu: Great support, super efficient, only thing is I do which it was easier to contact via chat or email for ease and quick answers

Review.Titre: Emil was EXTREMELY helpful!
Review.Contenu: Emil was EXTREMELY helpful! He answered all of my big and little questions with ease, responded quickly, and was patient and kind when I needed clarity. I'm always impressed with SiteGround's customer service—it is one of the main reasons I stick around as a customer year after year—but today was especially great with his help. (He totally deserves a raise! ;)) Cheers everyone and thanks always!

Review.Titre: Better than other beginner hosting services
Review.Contenu: Although I've had a few little buggy things occur here and there, their support has always shown up quite well to fix it. I think for beginner web agencies or solo DIY type people, it's a great service. I moved away from GoDaddy and I'm quite happy with the move.Only thing I'd say to caution new users is make sure you're looking at the monthly costs after the promotion period and then count the promotion as a little bonus and not the actual cost.

Review.Titre: Great responsive customer service and…
Review.Contenu: Great responsive customer service and excellent hosting company. I have been with them for 3 years and I like that they have 24/7 real people customer service. Make life easier instead of all these bots on other hosting services. Good job Siteground!

Review.Titre: Siteground hosting is money well spent…
Review.Contenu: Hosting with Siteground is money well spent. Sure, there are cheaper alternatives but they include poor service. It's hard having confidence that the best practices are being used in their server configurations.Back to SG - I've never had to wait more than 2 minutes for a live chat and have always had very knowledgeable, friendly and professional support staff on hand. For this reason alone - it's worth paying a little more but saving time, stress and hassle.SG's Wordpress performance plugin is also great and included with all WP hosting.

Review.Titre: Extremely Helpful
Review.Contenu: First. Extremely helpful, professional, and very fast at resolving my website issues. Customer service is what keeps us moving forward. Thank you for allowing me to move forward even faster. They are fantastic and explained everything clearly. Thanks

Review.Titre: listened to me
Review.Contenu: listened to me, then acted, very good pro, give him a pay rise, knows how to apply common sense to create a happy customer

Review.Titre: Fantastic experience
Review.Contenu: Fantastic experience.  I've been with Siteground since the beginning.  They keep getting better and better! Just don't lose that Customer Chat in favour of all AI, OKAY!!?!?!???

Review.Titre: Communication with SiteGround
Review.Contenu: I moved from a previous host to SiteGround recently. Good communication is important for me. So far, I've contacted SiteGround several times and every time I've found them easy and quick to contact by Chat or telephone (slightly more complicated). I am not technically knowledgeable, but all the staff I've communicated with have been patient and clear with their instructions and explanations.

Review.Titre: Elite chat support
Review.Contenu: I'm always happy to have chosen Siteground, legit the best chat support out there. Any technical issues you have just go to chat and they answer usually within a few mins.

Review.Titre: Confusing refund process.
Review.Contenu: I seem to have misunderstood the refund process as it was dictated on the site, which is admittedly misleading. After patiently waiting for what I thought was a refund window, I learned that I was outside the full refund period. I explained my POV to the service rep and he was able to resolve the issue and provide me with a full refund. Thank you.

Review.Titre: I got excellent customer support for a…
Review.Contenu: I got excellent customer support for a domain name issue. The rep was very knowledgeable and couldn't have been more helpful. SiteGround is the best hosting service I've used.

Review.Titre: Amazing service
Review.Contenu: Amazing service! Thank you so much for not only addressing my concerns, but the representative took the time to help and also gave me a great deal that was unexpected. Thank you!!

Review.Titre: Siteground service is on the money
Review.Contenu: Siteground service is on the money.  Customer support is excellent. Highly recommended.5 stars from me.Sarwan SumonInfoVaultltd.com

Review.Titre: Changing Domain and Website Hosts
Review.Contenu: This was my first experience with technical support.  My first tries to renew my longtime domain and Wordpress files from an increasingly expensive and previous host were not successful.  Once I learned to use the support here I got onto a live chat with Nikola and he fixed me right up in less than 5 mins.  He gave me the advice I needed to renew domains with Siteground and instructions of what to do with my previous provider to transfer my website files.  He was personable, knowledgable, fast, and obviously liked what he was doing so some panache came through. Very easy to communicate with him.

Review.Titre: Great service by Ekaterina and Vladislav
Review.Contenu: Great service provided by Ekaterina and Vladislav! solved my problem and offered alternative solutions and where friendly!

Review.Titre: Renewal time
Review.Contenu: They worked with me on my concern and we arrived at a very fair solution. I really do love their customer service and efficiency.

Review.Titre: Service team knocked out exactly what I…
Review.Contenu: Service team knocked out exactly what I was looking for and even had a refund on my hosting plan I was no longer using.

Review.Titre: Great support for novice web publisher
Review.Contenu: My site went down due to my failure to update some plugins.  I am a novice, this is my first and only website.  The Siteground folks were able to walk me through a process (not complex, but nothing I knew to do) via chat, got the whole thing squared away in 10 minutes.  It's the second time I have had an issue, and both times they were immediately respnsive and spot-on with their assistance.

Review.Titre: Siteground chat support has always…
Review.Contenu: Siteground chat support has always treated me with the utmost respect and figures my problems with me.

Review.Titre: I access support from SiteGround often - always awesome!
Review.Contenu: I access support from SiteGround often. I am a GrowBig plan user. As someone non-technical, I can confidently say that the SG support is second to none! They are ALWAYS helpful and informative and generally just awesome. Even though I know I could pay less elsewhere for hosting, I know from experience that I would not get this level of support. Experiences with other hosts have been awful. So, thanks SiteGround!

Review.Titre: Best support EVER ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Review.Contenu: Best support EVER. There is no other hosting provider that I've worked with that even comes close to the level of care SiteGround support engineers have. Had an issue that was related to my wordpress site where the images weren't loading. Most if not all other hosting support would have just said "Works on our end, the server works fine, there are no issues, please check your application / website" But not SiteGround - I jumped on a chat with them, the first tier support couldn't figure it out, they created a support ticket for me and in about an hour confirming they fixed the issue for me, and also giving a detailed report of why it was happening. Just. Amazing ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Review.Titre: SiteGround SCAM ALERT!!! 6X Overcharge! No Customer Service Repsonse !
Review.Contenu: 16 Dec 2023 update:Thanks for your reply.I received refund from SiteGround today.—————-I initially signed up for a SitGround yearly plan at USD 59.88 last year, only to fall victim to their renewal fees trap.  Expiration date and renewal:Despite receiving an email indicating I had 21 days before expiration, SiteGround auto-renewed and upgraded my plan within 5 days.Shocking Overcharge:They upgraded my plan from USD 59.88 to USD 358.88 without valid reason. What a total SCAM!No Customer Service Response:I have sent 4-5 emails and filled out their Service Evaluation form, yet NO ONE has contacted me!!!!I urge SiteGround to refund the overcharged amount and explain the unauthorized upgrade. I expect a prompt and satisfactory resolution to this matter.

Review.Titre: chat reps are fast curteous and efficient
Review.Contenu: chat reps always hop into the chat quicky, read the  information quickly to move the problem along as efficiently as possible. you never know how important something so simple can be until you dont have it lol

Review.Titre: Timohir was good at pinpointing errors
Review.Contenu: Timohir was good at pinpointing errorsHis actions took less than 5 mins to fix my hosting problem.

Review.Titre: I have been using Siteground for years
Review.Contenu: I have been using Siteground for years. Their service is second to none in my opinion. Very few issues, and the Customer service team are very friendly, easy to access, and the staff are very knowledgeable.ThanksMatt

Review.Titre: DNS issues. All sorted and pointed in the right areas.
Review.Contenu: he was very helpful, unfortunately I cannot spell his Name Arn something.  Anyway, he helped me get my domain pointed here to Siteground and have my email hosted at google, and nameservers are pointed here. *by the way you should customize this form so the customer support persons name or number auto populates! Thank you.

Review.Titre: Excellent support!
Review.Contenu: Excellent support!For a not-so-techie like me who always messed up with my site-building, the support is always available and patient. No matter how stupid my mistake was, I could get the assistance I needed.

Review.Titre: Best customer service, fastest website ever
